title: Tester with Workday
description:
```Job Overview:  
We are seeking a skilled Tester to join our team. As a Tester, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality and functionality of our software products. This is a critical role that requires attention to detail, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.

Responsibilities:  
- Conduct thorough testing of software applications to identify defects and ensure they meet quality standards  
- Develop and execute test cases, test scripts, and test plans

- Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail

Location: [LOCATION]

Join our team of dedicated professionals who are passionate about delivering high-quality software solutions. We offer competitive salaries, opportunities for career growth, and a supportive work environment. Apply now to become part of our dynamic team!

We are seeking a talented and creative Web Designer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for design, a strong understanding of user experience principles, and proficiency in various design tools and software. As a Web Designer, you will be responsible for creating visually appealing and user-friendly websites that align with our brand identity and meet the needs of our target audience.

title: AWS Developer
description:
About Telestream


For over 25 years, Telestream has been the undisputed trailblazer of innovation in the digital video industry. We craft cutting edge solutions for every facet of media processing and workflow orchestration. Whether it's the adrenaline-pumping live capture, seamless streaming, awe-inspiring production, or meticulous quality assurance of video content - Telestream stands as the unyielding force that ensures your video reaches audiences flawlessly, no matter how they are created, disseminated, or consumed.

  

Our roster of customers include most of the top Media & Entertainment, Video Production, Broadcasting and streaming companies in the world.

  

Now is the time for the next phase of Telestream's growth as we help our customers move to the next generation of video products and solutions that not only take advantage of traditional on premises solutions but are now moving to more hybrid and cloud based technologies and business solutions, while also incorporating AI into their video workflows.

 **AWS Developer - Remote, USA**

  

We are currently looking to hire an AWS developer who will play a crucial role in building scalable, secure, and cost-effective cloud solutions using AWS services and features . If you're passionate about cloud technology and software development, this career path offers exciting challenges.

 **Responsibilities:**

* design cloud-based infrastructure
* monitor and troubleshoot
* facilitate root cause analysis to identify and fix issues that may arise
* ensure reliable monitoring systems to maintain health of platform and reduce downtime
* participate in on call rotation with any customer escalations that arise
* Strive to improve efficiency and sustainability by developing and implementing policies, standards and procedures for the work performed
* Communicate technical information to technical and non-technical staff across the organization and with customers

 **Qualifications:**

* BSc in Computer Science or equivalent
* Proficiency in programming language C#
* Hands-on experience with one or more public cloud providers as we deploy in all environments (AWS required) - (EC2, AWS Networking)
* strong background with SQL
* excellent communicator with the ability to deal with a wide range of internal and external resources
* self sufficient individual who possesses initiative to make decisions and solve a variety of technical issues
* Windows & Linux OS experience

title: Creative Producer (part-time)
description:
We are **Joyteractive** - a leading mobile game developer and publisher specializing in the captivating world of puzzle games. Today, our team boasts 40+ rockstar professionals, and we're on the lookout for talented individuals to help us dominate the world of puzzles!

**Cryptogram: Word Brain Puzzle** is our leader, currently holding the #3 spot among all Word IOS, Android games in the US.


We are actively looking for a skilled **Creative Producer** with a demonstrated history of success in the gaming industry.


This will be a **part-time opportunity.**

**Responsibilities**:  

* Generate new ideas for new top creatives by analyzing the market, company experience, and competitors
* Control of UA-creative production, testing, and scaling processes
* Come up with and adapt the hypotheses while continuously studying the target audience
* Develop at least 5 creative scenarios per week for the design team
* Detail scenarios, interact with video production teams and create playable ads using Asana
* Interpret key business metrics and derive informed conclusions
* Conduct market analytics using tools such as Sensor Tower
* Exchange of experience and information within the team (test results, ideas, consultations, feedback, etc.)
**Requirements:**  

* Experience as a Creative Producer or similar role (UA Manager, Product Marketing Manager, Marketing Manager, PM, Lead Motion Designer)
* Demonstrated interest and experience working in the gaming industry
* Experience with major paid social and ad networks is a plus
* Versatile mind, able to learn fast and challenge business-as-usual operations
* Proficiency in English equivalent to a native speaker or C2 level
* A portfolio showcasing relevant work is mandatory

We would be happy to have a call with you to know more about your expertise and interests!

title: Microsoft 365 Administrator
description:
Evolver is seeking a M365 Administrator. The M365 Administrator's role is to provide administration and L3 technical support as a subject matter expert for Office 365 services, Exchange Online, SharePoint, Teams, Outlook, OneDrive, Security and Compliance to support lines of business. This role will work closely with the IT team to ensure the Office365 environment is optimized for performance and reliability.

**Responsibilities**

* Design, implement, and maintain the Microsoft 365 environment.
* Review and plan for upcoming feature releases & changes to user experience
* Communication and socialization of feature releases with users and helpdesk support staff

**Basic Qualifications**

* 5 years of experience with the following:
	+ Managing Microsoft 365 with specific expertise in SharePoint, Teams, and Exchange Online
	+ Exchange Online administration
	+ SharePoint Online administration
	+ MS Teams administration
	+ Security administration (Email & Collaboration)
	+ Compliance administration (DLP, Information Protection, Data Lifecycle Management, Vulnerability Remediation)
	+ Azure AD (Group Management, App Registrations)
	+ SharePoint 2013 Server support (in-flight migration project to decommission SP2013)
	+ Endpoint services (Intune for iOS)
	+ Office 365 Mobile and Desktop applications and add-ins
	+ Power Platform administration (DLP Polices, Environment settings, supporting PowerAutomate Flows, PowerApps)
* Bachelor's degree in IT or 10 years of work experience

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Proficient in PowerShell for basic commands/scripting
* Ability to triage tickets and troubleshoot independently
* Proficient troubleshooter with experience in Wireshark or Fiddler, and analyzing logs.
* Azure Certification highly preferred
* Expertise with command-line interfaces such as PowerShell
* Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts and details to individuals at all levels of the organization
* Experience creating documentation for user and technical audiences
* Ability to perform Root Cause Analysis across a complex environment
* Be highly motivated, able to work with minimal supervision, and adapt to changes as needed
* Possess exceptional attention to detail
* Experience with AvePoint
* Experience working in regulated industries specifically finance

  

Evolver is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes all job seekers. It is the policy of Evolver not to discriminate based on race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, age, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, genetic factors, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, military/veteran status, or any other factor protected by law.

title: IT Consultant
description:
**About Rockwood**  

  

Rockwood Company, LLC is a rapidly growing woman-owned small business change management consulting firm that delivers unrivaled value in the DC Metropolitan Area. Our IT Consultants are solution innovators who specialize in devising and implementing bold, yet practical solutions to complex problems. We work side-by-side with our clients to take on the most critical challenges our nation faces. Our goal is to enable a more innovative, collaborative, and effective government capable of successfully executing today's mission and anticipating tomorrow's evolving challenges and opportunities.
  

  

We bring human-centered design approaches to ensure our clients adopt and institutionalize sustainable change. Our core service offerings include strategy development and implementation, stakeholder alignment, customer experience, workforce readiness, strategic communications, and program management.
  

  

Rockwood provides a team-oriented learning environment that pushes our consultants to grow. Our team members own their own success and partner with leadership to achieve their professional development goals.  

  

  

  

**About the Position**  

The IT Consultant will participate and manage a variety of IT initiatives that help clients achieve their missions while teaching them sustainable ways to effectively achieve outcomes. Specific responsibilities may include:


* IT strategy development, planning and implementation focused on enterprise goals, objectives and task
* Development of a technology roadmap that aligns IT strategic initiatives with the agency business needs
* Identifies cohesive metrics and monitoring components
* Supports IT related Committees and Working Groups from opportunity definition, planning, agency engagement and execution
* Collaborates with diversified stakeholders to develop business capability maps, process maps, value stream maps to meet organizational needs
* Prepares reports, streamlines business processes, and documents project plans and processes
* Monitors and explores industry and technology trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions to assess applicability and viability for state agencies
* Captures the current state of the client mission and recommend best practice alternatives for a future state
* Help define, create, test, and execute operations procedures
* Design, develop, and/or present client deliverables, applying basic consulting principles and frameworks (may include creating the deliverable structure and approach, writing, editing, formatting, and enhancing with graphical or technical software)
* Build trusting relationships with clients while helping them dissect and solve problems
* Preference for familiarity with ServiceNow

**What You Must Have to Be a IT Consultant**

* Active security clearance (DoD or equivalent ideally, must be at least Secret level)
* 2-5 years of relevant work experience
* Bachelor's degree
* Experience in information systems analysis, design & operations
* Experience working with multiple IT solutions
* Innate ability to proactively and creatively problem-solve
* Ability to support IT related consulting efforts within the federal government space
* Strategic thinking who can work in fast paced and changing environment
* Active listening and critical thinking skills to make connections and extract key takeaways from a discussion
* Strong verbal and written communications skills to organize information into well-written clear messages and compelling documents
* Ability to collaboratively brainstorm and work with clients and Rockwood team while also having the ability to work independently from a home office, client site, and Rockwood office as required
* Willingness to commute to client location in and around the DC Metro area; occasional travel outside of the DC area, i.e. Quantico, VA

 **Our Unique Benefits**

* Competitive medical, dental, and vision insurance plans
* Employer paid short-term, long-term disability, and life insurance
* Rockwood will match eligible 401(k) plan members' contributions in an amount equal to 100% of your employee contributions, not to exceed 4%
* Generous paid vacation
* Eight federal paid holidays
* Continuous education budget
* Spot cash bonuses and additional vacation days throughout the year to consultants who go above and beyond their job and bring exceptional value to the company, the team, and clients
* Tuition reimbursement
* Choice of cell phone, hotspot, or internet reimbursement
* Wellness stipend (for gym membership and other wellness related activities)
* All company gatherings and events
* Participation in a wellness program to earn money that Rockwood will donate to charity of your choice
* Laptop, office supplies, and other equipment to maximize effectiveness when working from a home office (when necessary)
* Paid maternity and parental leave
  

  

Rockwood Company values creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. If you have a disability and would like to request an accommodation in order to apply for a position with Rockwood, please e-mail careers@rockwoodcompany.com  

  

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

title: HRIS Analyst
description:
Do you want to change the world? We do, too.

SunPower is changing the way our world is powered every day with a passionate and driven team in North America and the Philippines. SunPower provides world-class solar solutions to residential customers across the U.S. with a commitment to a superior customer experience. We welcome forward thinkers, freedom chasers and all those demanding better, cleaner energy to join us. **Summary of Role:**  

Oversees the development, implementation, and maintenance of the company’s policies and procedures related to the administration of Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS) to support the long- and short-term business goals of various functions. Delivers automated HR solutions to the business to drive efficiencies and cost savings. Provides HR and leadership with ongoing consultation on processes and tools, which facilitate the administration of quality and timely data. Works with HR to evaluate HRIS software and hardware needs and may design new or modify existing HRIS to meet changing demands.  


### **Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**

* SuccessFactors/HRIS Focus
* Delivers domain expertise on HR systems based upon functional areas or projects assigned and rives day-to-day operational administration of SuccessFactors and other HR information systems, including configuration, testing, and troubleshooting of issues related to business processes, security, and reporting
* Modules may include Core HCM, Recruiting, Onboarding, Absence Management, Benefits, Talent/Performance, and Compensation
* Develops customer relationships by demonstrating a desire to understand their business processes and challenges while demonstrating a continuous improvement mentality and an ability to execute
* Leads the development of end-user requirements and documentation
* Provides input to change management strategy and deployment from a systems perspective
* Performs configuration builds, testing, and troubleshooting
* Acts as a liaison between our customers and IT or third-party systems vendors
* Identifies and recommends process improvements, system enhancements, and new applications to support business strategies and operational needs
* Assesses current HR Technology trends and new systems release features for incumbent applications.
* Supports audit and compliance efforts, where necessary

  

* Project Management
* Helps to provide a strategic approach to identify, prioritize, and successfully execute a broad portfolio of HR initiatives and projects
* Ensures all HR projects undertaken align with HR’s strategic vision and facilitate HR PMO budget prioritization process and key forums
* Manages all aspects of program execution from scope definition, planning, risk/issue management, status management and communications
* Ensures budget and resources required for HR projects are properly scoped and then monitored and managed via change control
* Anticipates and aggressively removes obstacles that slow down or prevent HR programs from delivering on stated objectives
* Focus on continuous improvement and identify opportunities to make HR PMO processes more efficient and effective
* Prepare executive-level presentations related to programs
* Communicate status of HR initiatives on regular basis to HR leadership and other executives as needed

### **Required Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related field or equivalent, combined experience
* 5+ years’ designing, managing, and administering HRIS platforms
* 3+ Hands on experience working in SuccessFactors modules
* 3+ Project Management experience

### **Preferred Qualifications:**

* Strong exposure and knowledge of various types of HR information systems across the HR function: HCM, LMS, ATS,
* Demonstrated knowledge of HRIS practices and platforms with an ability to provide guidance to leaders and employees through a consultative approach
* Experience presenting to leadership in the company
* Experience working with HR functional roles and serving clients
* Experience with analytics, Excel, PowerPoint and HR Systems
* Experience working in performance-focused environments and administering programs
* Knowledge and experience in HRIS strategies and practices


Please note the pay range provided is a good faith estimate for this position only and in the geographical location noted. The base pay for this position ranges from $89,000/year to $167,200/year. Pay is based on several factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Dependent on the position offered, other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package including annual bonus eligibility, short and long-term incentives, and a comprehensive and competitive benefits program which includes health insurance coverage, employee wellness, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays, paid time off, and so much more.For more information, please visit our benefits site athttps://us.sunpower.com/employees-benefits.  

Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and underrepresented minorities are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At SunPower, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. **Equal Employment Opportunity**
The Company is an equal employment opportunity employer and makes employment decisions, including but not limited to, hiring, firing, promotion, demotion, training, and/or compensation, on the basis of merit. Employment decisions are based on an individual’s qualifications as they relate to the job under consideration. The Company’s policy prohibits unlawful discrimination based on sex (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions, the actual sex of the individual, or the gender identity or gender expression), race, color, religion, including religious dress practices and religious grooming practices, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, familial status, age, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, protected veteran or military status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state or local laws, ordinances, or regulations. The Company is committed to complying with all applicable laws providing equal employment opportunities. This commitment applies to all persons involved in the operations of the Company and prohibits unlawful discrimination by any employee of the Company, including supervisors and co-workers.  

EOE Minorities/All Genders/Protected Veterans/Disabled  

SunPower Supports EEO **Accommodation for Applicants to SunPower Corporation**
SunPower Corporation is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer and provides reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in job application procedures. title: Senior Healthcare IT Project Consultant - Remote
description:
Optum is a global organization that delivers care, aided by technology to help millions of people live healthier lives. The work you do with our team will directly improve health outcomes by connecting people with the care, pharmacy benefits, data and resources they need to feel their best. Here, you will find a culture guided by diversity and inclusion, talented peers, comprehensive benefits and career development opportunities. Come make an impact on the communities we serve as you help us advance health equity on a global scale. Join us to start **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**

  

The Consultant Data, Research Analyst will apply statistical and econometric methods to support consulting projects. This individual will perform analyses of data and interpret results to ensure validity of conclusions. The Analyst will extract or process internal or external data to support client projects through application of internal tools and externally provided software such as SAS and Micro Strategies.

  

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely \\* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

  

**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Develop reports and presentations based on project specifications for delivery to clients
* Perform statistical quality assurance review and program validation for each project
* Provide analytical and data support for case studies and business proposals
* Interact with other departments to ensure a high level of client satisfaction through successful execution of projects
* Leverage skills to support creation of product improvements and new product offerings targeted at the sales and market research community requirements

  

  

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**


* 2+ years healthcare consulting experience
* Experience with statistical analyses of clinical data
* Intermediate level of proficiency in Excel, Access, SAS, and SQL
* Proficient with problem resolution, collection of relevant health care trend, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions
* Proven excellent written and verbal interpersonal communication skills
* Proven solid ability to pay attention to details
* Proven excellent time and resource management skills
* Proven ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment

  

  

* All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy
  

**California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Rhode Island, or Washington Residents Only:** The salary range for California, Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Rhode Island or Washington residents is $88,000 to $173,200 annually. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.

  

*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes - an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*



*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

  

*UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.*

title: Tibco Statistica Consultant
description:
Job Description:

* Develop an automated system for Continued Process Verification (CPV), integrating Spotfire SDK Developer, TIBCO Data Science Workbench, and Advance Statistica.
* Gather analytics requirements from business users and perform CPV analysis.
* Design and implement end-to-end CPV analysis workflow in TIBCO Statistica (now TIBCO Data Science Workbench), interfacing with Spotfire for data gathering and processing.
* Develop algorithms for identification and notification of Out of Specification (OOS) and Out of Trend (OOT) results.
* Analyze and trend Critical Process Parameters (CPPs), Critical Quality Attributes (CQAs), and In-Process Control parameters (IPCs) using the developed system.
* Generate visualizations and statistical outputs for control charts, variability charts, process capability charts, runs charts, and distribution charts.
* Model data from various data sources including OSI Pi.
* Create custom data entry and date configuration modules using TIBCO's Statistica Web Data Entry component rendered through TIBCO WebStatistica Server.
* Implement Alarm Checking mechanisms to detect anomalies using TIBCO Statistica's Monitoring and Alerting (MAS) Server, sending email notifications for high criticality issues.
* Produce Statistica data outputs for consumption by TIBCO Spotfire for analytics and reporting.
* Periodically test and deploy solutions in validated environments following standard promotion processes.
* Execute IQ (Installation Qualification), OQ (Operational Qualification), and Validation Protocols.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $120.00 - $130.00 per hour

Experience level:

* 11+ years

Experience:

* Tibco Statistica Consultant: 10 years (Preferred)
* Spotfire SDK Developer: 10 years (Preferred)
* TIBCO Data Science Workbench: 10 years (Preferred)
* Advance Statistica: 10 years (Preferred)
* TIBCO Statistica’s Web Data Entry: 10 years (Preferred)
* TIBCO WebStatistica: 10 years (Preferred)
* TIBCO Statistica's Monitoring and Alerting (MAS) Server: 10 years (Preferred)
* Create and execute IQ (Installation Qualification): 10 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Sr. Consultant, Incident Response (Remote)
description:
#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.
About the Role:
CrowdStrike is looking for highly motivated, self-driven, technical consultants dedicated to making a difference in global security by protecting organizations against the most advanced attackers in the world. Our CrowdStrike Services team offers opportunities to expand your skill set through a wide variety of engagements including front page incident response investigations, adversary-focused penetration testing (be the adversary, don’t just run scans), and proactive and strategic assessment services for organizations you’ll find on the annual Fortune 100 list.  

Am I a Senior Consultant Candidate?* Do you find yourself interested in and keeping up with the latest vulnerabilities and breaches?
* Are you self-motivated and looking for an opportunity to rapidly accelerate your skills?
* Do you crave new and innovative work that actually matters to your customer?
* Do you have an Incident Response or Information Security background that you’re not fully utilizing?
* Are you capable of leading teams and interacting with customers?
* Do you love working around like-minded, smart people who you can learn from and mentor on a daily basis?


What You'll Do:* Lead incident response engagements and serve as the primary point of contact for the customer throughout the investigation.
* Perform host and/or network-based forensics across Windows, Mac, and Linux platforms.
* Perform basic malware analysis.
* Produce high-quality written and verbal reports, presentations, security-focused recommendations, and factual findings to customer management, regulators, and legal counsel.
* Assess and develop actionable, and impactful mitigation and containment measures during active incident response investigations.
* Demonstrate industry thought leadership through blog posts, CrowdCasts, and other public speaking events.


What You'll Need:  

*Successful candidates will have experience in one or more of the following areas:** Incident Response: experience performing or managing incident response investigations for organizations, investigating targeted threats such as the Advanced Persistent Threat, Organized Crime, and Hacktivists.
* Threat Hunting: experience developing analytics and hunting through large datasets for adversary activity, experience with Splunk or other big data platforms is preferred.
* Computer Forensic Analysis: a background using a variety of forensic analysis tools in incident response investigations to determine the extent and scope of compromise.
* Network Forensic Analysis: knowledge of network protocols, network analysis tools, and ability to perform analysis of associated network logs.
* Reverse Engineering: ability to perform basic static and dynamic malware analysis.
* Incident Remediation: strong understanding of targeted attacks and able to create customized tactical and strategic remediation plans for compromised organizations.
* Network Operations and Architecture/Engineering: strong understanding of secure network architecture and strong background in performing network operations.
* Programming/Scripting: experience coding in Go, PowerShell, Python, or Perl.

*Additionally, all candidates must possess the following qualifications:** Capable of completing technical tasks without supervision.
* Desire to grow and expand both technical and soft skills.
* Strong project management skills.
* Contributing thought leader within the incident response industry.
* Ability to foster a positive work environment and attitude.
* Ability to travel on short notice, up to 20% of the time.


Education:
BA or BS / MA or MS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Math, Information Security, Information Assurance, Information Security Management, Intelligence Studies, Cybersecurity, Cybersecurity Policy, or a related field. Applicants without a degree but with relevant work experience and/or training will be considered.
#LI-DL1
#LI-Remote
This role may require the candidate to periodically undergo and pass alcohol and/or drug test(s) during the course of employment.
Benefits of Working at CrowdStrike:* Remote-first culture
* Market leader in compensation and equity awards
* Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements
* Comprehensive and inclusive health benefits
* Physical and mental wellness programs
* Paid parental leave, including adoption
* A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities
* Offices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaboration


We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve.
CrowdStrike is committed to maintaining an environment of Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action. If you need reasonable accommodation to access the information provided on this website, please contact Recruiting@crowdstrike.com, for further assistance.
CrowdStrike participates in the E-Verify program.
Notice of E-Verify Participation
Right to Work
CrowdStrike, Inc. is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The base salary range for this position in the U.S. is $105,000 - $160,000 per year + variable/incentive compensation + equity + benefits. A candidate’s salary is determined by various factors including, but not limited to, relevant work experience, skills, certifications and location.

title: Software Tester
description:
**Software TesterRemote Position, HQ Lacey, WA**

**Employment Type:** Full Time/Salaried Non-Exempt

**Experience:** Entry to Intermediate Level

**Salary Range:** $56,000 - $61,000 per year

**Industry:** Software, Information Technology, and Services

Employees are covered by medical, dental, vision, and AD&D insurance. Alliance offers a 401k plan in addition to 11 paid holidays and paid time off. Employees may also receive discretionary bonuses throughout the year.

Join our innovative department dedicated to designing, implementing, and testing features for our Vocational Rehabilitation case management software. Our application helps people with disabilities connect to services and meaningful employment. This software is used nationwide, and your work will directly and significantly impact the lives of others.

As part of a cross-functional scrum team, you will work closely with Business Systems Analysts, Software Developers, and Software Testers to test new features, updated functionality, and corrections. You'll find opportunities to participate in multiple phases of the Software Development Lifecycle, learn new skills and technologies, and contribute to department goals and objectives.

**Here is a little window into our company:** Alliances Enterprises, Inc founded in 1981, has a history of providing innovative technology-based solutions. Alliance specializes in developing applications that support vocational rehabilitation agencies in assisting people with disabilities to obtain long-term employment. At Alliance, we invest in people, meaning we push our employees to increase their business savvy, technical knowledge, and industry perspective. Our employees are trustworthy and care about each other and our customers; we work together to support the vocational rehabilitation industry. Alliance Enterprises was acquired by Valsoft and now operates under the Aspire Software portfolio. Aspire Software, the operational arm of Valsoft Corp, operates and manages Valsoft’s global portfolio of wholly owned software companies, providing mission-critical solutions across multiple verticals. By implementing industry best practices, Aspire delivers a time-sensitive integration process, and the operation of a decentralized model has allowed it to become a hub for creating rapid growth by reinvesting in its portfolio.

**What your day will look like****:**

* Create and modify simple to moderately complex test plans
* Work with cross-team staff to ensure that requirements are well understood
* Review design specifications to understand the scope, requirements, and function of the software product with team members
* Identify appropriate parameters, functions, and data to test and validate; parameters may include general function, validity of results, accuracy, reliability, and compliance with industry standards
* Conduct testing to ensure products perform according to user requirements and within established guidelines
* Identify, log, and recreate error codes, bugs, and defects
* Report defects to programmers when a product does not perform within specifications

**About You****:**

* **3+ years of experience testing web applications in a business environment, Quality Assurance testing methodologies, and writing test plans**
* Excellent communication, writing, and analytical problem-solving skills
* Curious, inquisitive, and detail-oriented
* Willingness to learn and take on new challenges; self-directed and highly motivated.
* Solid experience with Microsoft Office
* Experience in automation testing
* Understanding of Transact SQL, SQL Server, .NET Framework, HTML and XML
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Azure DevOps
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent years of experience
* Primarily a stationary position. May have occasional opportunities to move about within an office environment
* Operation of a computer and typical office machinery
* Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times
* **Legally authorized to work in the US**

For information about **Alliance Enterprises**, please visit our website at www.allianceenterprises.com

**We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $56,000.00 - $61,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 3 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: SAP S/4 Consultant I
description:
**Job Summary:**


NavAide is currently seeking candidates at **all levels** in support of an SAP S/4 modernization with a US Navy client. Currently seeking functional, technical, and analytical support across all SAP S/4 modules and scenarios including: Finance/Controlling (FI/CO), Funds Management (FM), Asset Management (AM), Project Systems (PS), Sales & Distribution (SD), Workforce Management (HCM/WFM), Materials Management (MM), Workflow, Business Objects Data Services (BODS), Security/Roles/User Management, Acquire to Dispose (A2D), Budget to Authorize (B2A), Check In to Check Out (C2C), Plan to Perform (P2Pf), Plan to Pay (P2Py), Post to Report (P2R), as well as SAP's Defense and Security (D&S) solution. We are seeing exceptional growth and are looking for driven candidates that thrive in a fast-paced and evolving environment.

  

**Responsibilities & Duties:**


* Provide expertise to confirm/develop business requirements definition.
* Provide configuration, data migration, interface, and functional support as necessary.
* Develop and maintain systems documentation including business process procedures, functional design specifications, process flows, and test cases.
* Prepare/conduct briefings, demos or training sessions as needed.


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Engineering, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a similar field.
* 3-15+ years of experience with SAP implementation projects within large organizations or government agencies.
* Experience with SAP S/4 modules such as FI, CO, FM, PS, SD, MM, and others.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and stakeholder management abilities, with a customer-centric approach.
* Experience with the DON and Navy processes and policies is highly preferred.

**Security Clearance:** Candidates must possess, or be eligible to receive, US DoD Secret-level Security Clearance


**Travel:** ~25% travel may be required


**About NavAide:**


NavAide is a rapidly growing consulting group of highly skilled and motivated industry experts with decades of experience in legacy system modernization, business process reengineering, policy, and audit support. We leverage cutting-edge technology and proven deployment methodologies to help our clients face challenges and navigate complex transitions. For more about us, please check out the following links:


* About NavAide - https://navaide.com/about-us
* Other Opportunities - https://navaide.com/jobs
* Employee Benefits - https://navaide.com/careers
* Connect with us on LinkedIn! - https://www.linkedin.com/compa... (https://www.linkedin.com/company/navaide)


NavAide is an EEO Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: VP, Consulting - Virtual
description:
At Diversified, we don't just follow tech trends - we set them by leveraging the best in technology and ongoing advisory services to transform businesses. Our comprehensive suite of solutions is engineered to help our clients build connections that make a difference – whether by inspiring viewers, engaging associates, motivating audiences, or streamlining and safeguarding operations.
  
Our dedicated teams craft solutions experienced by millions every day including:
  
* Delivering the fan experience at one of 100+ sports facilities for the NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, MLS, NCAA
* Building the first fly pack broadcast system transportable by air - bringing the 2022 World Cup and Super Bowl into homes across the world
* Engineering the first high-density pixel canvas to display HD content at that scale for the Vornado, Marriott Marquis LED Display in Times Square, NY
* Empowering and monitoring communication and collaboration solutions within multi-national companies around the globe


Founded in 1993, we’re a global organization serving local needs with associates worldwide. Learn more at onediversified.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
  
  

What part will you play?
  
Diversified continues to expand our thought leadership team to grow our Consulting practice further, encompassing a larger focus across our company’s business units of Media and Workplace with the addition of a Vice President of Consulting.
  
We are seeking a Vice President of Consulting, to spearhead our Consulting practice across Media and Workplace verticals. This executive role is pivotal in leading a team of consultants and subject matter experts, driving excellence in thought leadership, customer service, and business acumen. The Vice President, Consulting, will be instrumental in shaping the strategic direction of the consulting division, ensuring the delivery of high-value, outcome focused solutions to our clients, and fostering a culture of innovation and collaboration.
  
The Consulting team is staffed with, among other roles, Principal Consultants across multiple disciplines inclusive of transformation efforts, Media supply chain initiatives, and Experiential Workplace solutions. These consultants serve as lead advisors for key/enterprise clients and strategic projects. The VP of Consulting is responsible, at an executive level, for the overarching deliverables supporting the decisions and recommendations made within the team, inclusive of the team itself and their activities.
  
What will you be doing?
  
* The VP of Consulting is a senior leadr within the Consulting staff and offers top down expertise, resources, and guidance to help our clients succeed in their industry. As a VP of Consulting, you may specialize in a variety of technologies/practice areas, and your duties include:
* Provide visionary leadership for the Consulting practice, setting strategic goals and driving business growth across Media and Workplace sectors.
* Lead, mentor, and expand a team of consultants and subject matter experts, fostering an environment of professional development and excellence.
* Oversee the sales process, from lead generation to deal closure, ensuring a high standard of customer service and satisfaction.
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with key clients and business partners, understanding their business needs and delivering tailored consulting solutions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the integration of consulting services with One Diversified's broader offerings.
* Drive thought leadership in the industry, representing the company at conferences, panels, and networking events.
* Ensure the consulting practice's offerings remain at the forefront of industry trends and technological advancements.
* Report to the Senior Vice President of Consulting, providing regular updates on practice performance, market opportunities, and strategic initiatives.


You should expect to work, both in a leadership and supporting function, on several projects across multiple clients as you immerse yourself in their business imperatives and processes, advise on business strategy and tactics, and provide vision and direction for the team.
  
You are responsible for the leadership and ultimate execution of the engagement deliverables, which will follow Diversified’s highest standards for quality and presentation with C-Level caliber collateral.
  
Ideally, You will maintain a subject matter expert role versed in a variety of technologies, including intimate knowledge of vendor product offerings, and a firm perspective on the competitive landscape. Additionally, you will serve as an industry evangelist representing Diversified at global technology conferences, customer engagements and publications in both print and online.
  
  

**Other duties will include:**  

* Develop deep working relationships with Senior Executives and Senior Managers across the client account teams.
* Understand the business direction of clients, Building knowledge capital through research and development, leveraging industry insights to deliver best of breed solutions to clients.
* Helping grow consulting Globally through thought leadership and entrepreneurialism.
* Function as the main contact between Diversified and client from beginning to end of a project/engagement ensuring the team meets the client's needs.
* Develop relationships throughout the customer's organization to identify new business opportunities.
* Participate with Sales during the sales process through scoping workshops, presentations, solutions, development of SOW's.
* Provide the bridge between Sales and Professional Services as new opportunities are closed.
* Create an environment where others feel it is safe to be open and candid, and where conflicting ideas and opinions are regularly discussed.
* Participate in projects involving strategy, implementation support, and optimization related to digital solutions media supply chain.
* Responsible to collaborate on the creation of project deliverables inclusive of the recommendations of technology, Bills of Materials, design concepts and deployment strategies, and quoting and support in vendor negotiations


**Complexity:**  

Highly Complex; The Principal Consultant needs to be able to assimilate complex areas of technology to conceptualize and communicate these to customers at the highest level.
  
  

**Decision Making Authority:**  

The Principal Consultant role reports to the Head of the Consulting department and will direct teams of other consultants, solutions architects along with vendors and customers throughout an engagement lifecycle. They will work with the Diversified account executives to make informed business decisions that will benefit the customer’s desired outcome.
  
  

**Physical Working Environment:**  

Limited physical labor required; most work will be performed on a computer. Remote or On-Site. Up to 50% travel may be expected.
  
What do we require from you?
  
  

**Education/Certifications:**  

* 4-year degree in a relevant business / technology field of study or equivalent experience.
* Experienced with technology and business operations and strategies relevant to the production, processing and distribution of audiovisual content for a variety of industries, including media, financial, retail, etc.


**Required/Desired Knowledge, Experience and Skills:**  

* You are an undisputed expert in your field(s) of technology and business, with 10+ years of experience as a solutions architect/engineer and trusted customer advisor.
* Your educational and professional background is varied and multifaceted and has equipped you with a broad perspective on business and technology, rooted in practical work as an engineer, solution sales professional, or other customer-facing roles.
* You are skilled at problem-solving, identifying issues, and conceptualizing solutions and you’re able to articulate a clear roadmap for implementing those solutions.
* As a Principal Consultant, you may be responsible for multiple projects at the same time, so it is necessary to have strong organizational skills that enable you to manage your time and responsibilities effectively and efficiently. Your organizational skills will also be required to keep track of client information, project details and other important data.
* You are able to manage time to plan and execute tasks effectively and efficiently within a set time frame for yourself and others to manage your own workload and that of your team members, ensuring that tasks are completed on time.
* You are trained, certified or deeply experienced in working with many of the following platforms: Platforms for compute, storage, orchestration and media processing, including AWS, Azure, Google, SAN/NAS, Object Storage (cloud/remote/on-premises), transcoding (Vantage, Elemental), MAMs (Iconik, CatDV, Dalet Flex, Vidispine, Avid MediaCentral/Interplay), Editorial, (Avid, Adobe, Apple, DaVinci), Cloud/hybrid Workflow, Remote workflow (Teradici, BeBop, etc.) and Virtualization Platforms (VMWare ESXi), as well as other media-related systems and solutions
* You have an in-depth understanding of media production, processing and distribution workflows for both live and fille-based content.
* You have excellent communication skills to both listen, understand, and convey important and complex technical information to clients, other consultants and other professionals.
* You are able to communicate effectively with vendors and manufacturers about RFQ technology, pricing and terms.
* You are a highly self-motivated self-starter who can operate independently as well as collaboratively with other Diversified team members to multi-task in an energetic environment.
* Must have the ability to communicate confidently with customers on a 1-on-1 and group setting.
* Must be willing to travel and able to work in a light industrial environment.
* Demonstrated ability to carry out consulting activities, methodologies leading to comprehensive discovery, analysis and technical/business recommendations.
* Advanced communication skills, including business/technical writing and presentations.
* Advanced ability to present in-depth technical solutions
* Self-motivation with the ability to motivate and energize a project team
* Demonstrate ability to work successfully at all customer levels from C-level executives to end users
* Thoughtful leadership and innovative thinking.


To learn more about becoming part of the Diversified team, visit us at http://diversifiedus.com/about/careers/ or email us at careers@onediversified.com.
  
  

Diversified is an equal employment opportunity employer and all aspects of employment will be based on job requirements, individual qualifications, merit, performance and business needs. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, age, disability or genetic information, or any other applicable characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. We celebrate diversity and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply for available positions. Individuals needing assistance or an accommodation to complete an application due to a disability, may contact Human Resources at careers@onediversified.com.

title: HRIS Analyst
description:
At GoHealth Urgent Care, we place the needs of our patients first - by providing an effortless patient experience, a welcoming culture of care and seamless integration with market-leading health systems and our communities.  

  

The HRIS Analyst plays a key role in the development, implementation and maintenance of the People Team technology systems associated with the collection, retrieval, accessibility and usage of team member information for GoHealth’s People Team department planning, activities and total rewards. The HRIS Analyst will identify areas of opportunity to improve existing People Team processes, functionality and workflows, and maximize technological capabilities to reduce manual processes (i.e. annual performance review process, onboarding, reporting) and to improve data management and efficiency. Maintains and develops custom reports to meet the requirements of People Team management and staff. Ensures accuracy and completeness of data in master files and various support tools. Establishes and maintains security and integrity controls. Trains and provides troubleshooting tips to other People Team members on features and functionality of the People Team technology systems and applications as needed. Works with payroll to coordinate retrieval and reporting functions. Audit HRIS feeds against carrier reporting. Serves as HR department liaison to IT function as it pertains to HRIS.

 **JOB REQUIREMENTS**  

  

**Education**

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Sciences or business related discipline required

  

**Work Experience**
  

* Minimum 2-4 years’ experience managing various HRIS programs required
* Proficiency with Dayforce, UltiPro, ADP, SAP, Workday or other HRIS and web-based management tools required
* Microsoft Excel super use experience (pivot tables, Vlookup, databases) required
* HR systems reporting, HR process and project management experience required
* Dayforce experience required \\*\\*\\*\\*
* Proven organization skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
* Exceptional analytical, problem solving and time-management skills
* Demonstrated experience/maturity to handle confidential and sensitive information

  

**Required Licenses/Certifications**  

  

* PHR, SPHR, or sHRBP preferred

  

**Essential Functions**  

* **System Optimization:**
	+ Analyze and report the need for system enhancement or customization
	+ Support the implementation/maintenance of various modules within the HRIS system
	+ Data mapping within the HRIS system and assure data integrity of HR information globally
	+ Primary liaison for HRIS and other HR technology platforms (eg, HR surveys, Learning Management System, ATS system, scheduling system)
	+ Determine the validity of other modules within the HRIS and ensure current modules are being utilized and optimized to the fullest
	+ Recommend changes to current processes to provide more effective use of the HRIS, and take the lead as a project manager to implement these changes (i.e. onboarding and exits, org charts, employment changes, performance management, recruitment, etc.)
	+ Work closely and collaboratively with benefits administration in ensuring open enrollment system functionality meets the needs of the organization and reflects the accuracy of the benefits renewal rates and policy
	+ Responsible for maintaining integrations between all HR systems, including but not limited to: Applicant Tracking (ATS), HR Data (HRIS), and Learning Management (LMS)
	+ Works closely with IT to enhance and maintain system automations throughout People Team Systems
	+ Acts as back-up system admin for ATS and scheduling system functionality
	+ Project manager for new market implementations
* **Analytics:**
	+ Develop and generate ad hoc reports to provide HR with timely and accurate data
	+ Create and maintain documentation of reporting processes and training guides for end users
* **Audits and Compliance**:
	+ Develop a regular monthly audit schedule to review the integrity of data in the HRIS system and databases
	+ Serve as the primary liaison for annual data testing and auditing for HR team and other compliance requirements


Note: this job description is not inclusive of all the duties of the position. You may be asked by leaders to perform other duties. Management reserves the right to revise this position description at any time.

title: Functional Analyst/Tester
description:
cFocus Software seeks a Functional Analyst/Tester to join our program supporting the US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), Office of the Inspector General. This is a fully remote position. This position requires an active Public Trust clearance and must meet 8570 requirements.

title: Technical Help Desk Supervisor
description:
Do you enjoy working with the senior community?

Who we are:

Since our founding in 2011, our mission has been to improve the lives of seniors and their caregivers. We are deeply passionate about communication and committed to becoming the foremost provider of services and solutions that enable seniors to lead more meaningful and independent lives. We also understand the power of connection and the profound impact it has on the lives of individuals who are hard-of-hearing. By utilizing enhanced automatic speech recognition, human captioning, and innovative product development, we deliver easy-to-use, cutting-edge technology to our primarily senior customer base. Our near real-time phone captioning technology allows individuals with hearing loss to see what callers are saying, enabling them to regain their connection to the world.

ClearCaptions is a Federal Communications Commission (FCC)-certified telephone captioning provider, adhering to the highest industry standards of privacy, security, and professionalism. We recognize the importance of maintaining the trust and confidence of our customers, and we continually strive to exceed their expectations.

For more information about our services please visit clearcaptions.com.

**Position Summary:**

The Technical Helpdesk Support Supervisor assists in leading and developing a team of Technical Helpdesk Specialist to deliver a world-class customer experience through regular coaching, training, and hands on experience. This role supports company and departmental goals by directly influencing the frontlines to answer contacts within SLA, follows department and company procedures, and ultimately wins and retains customers.

This is a Remote/Work from Home position reporting to the Sr. Customer Experience Manager.

**What you will do:**

* Oversee the development, implementation, and administration of help desk staff training procedures and policies.
* Demonstrate ownership in troubleshooting and resolving technical issues as well as identifying trends and root causes.
* Develop partnerships with cross functional teams to help improve and shape how Technical Helpdesk will handoff work, partner on strategic initiatives and improve the customer experience.
* Maintaining and updating records and tracking databases.
* Analyze reporting to identify performance trends and opportunities for improvement.
* Track and analyze trends in Help Desk requests and generate statistical reports.
* Provide weekly team and periodic 1:1 coaching to team members.
* Support and deliver the company culture and directives.
* Using ITIL-based processes to streamline the ingestion, triage, categorization, action, and resolution for incoming incidents, requests, and demands.
* Identify gaps in processes and partner to remediate.
* Ensure compliance guidelines are understood and followed.
* Maintain assigned team’s attendance records.
* Complete trainings as scheduled and identifies new opportunities for growth.
* Provide backup to peers and leadership when necessary.
* Monitor and test fixes to ensure problems have been adequately resolved.
* Maintains consistent professional development through company provided workshops, training, and development opportunities.
* Perform other related duties as assigned.

**Qualifications:**

* Must have current CCNA certification.
* Bachelor’s degree in Networking and Systems Administration or equivalent work experience.
* Minimum 5+ years of successful technical leadership experience.
* Minimum 5+ years of successful call center leadership experience.
* Must have a good technical understanding of modems, Routers, VoIP, DNS, VPN, TCP /IP, and DHCP
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, presentation, and problem-solving skills.
* Experience utilizing network monitoring platforms or custom tools.
* Willingness to work flexible schedules including weekends.
* Requires strong problem solving, time management, flexibility, and communication skills.
* Must have the ability to multi-task, organize and document many tasks at one time.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, presentation, and problem-solving skills.
* Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes.
* Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment.
* Experience in professional and business writing.
* Proficient in MS Office, modern communication tools for virtual teams (i.e., MS Teams, SLACK, and other virtual work platforms)
* Ability to problem solve with limited information.
* Ability to plan and manage at both strategic and tactical operational levels. Works to achieve goals while overcoming obstacles and/or planning for contingencies.
* Must have strong computer skills and knowledge of basic telephone technology.
* Good organizational skills and attention to detail are essential.
* Must have good interpersonal and active listening skills.
* Exceptional customer service skills are a must.

Physical Demands:Employees may experience the following physical demands for extended periods of time:· Sitting, standing, and walking (95-100%)· Keyboarding (70-90%)· Viewing computer monitor, tablet, and/or cell phone requiring close vision (70-90%)

**Work Environment:**

* *100% Remote:* Work environment is at home.

**Compensation:**

$60,854.00 to $72,414.00/yr with consideration to experience and geographical location. Please see www.clearcaptions.com/careers for an overview of our generous benefits program.

Intrigued to learn more?  
When you apply for this role, your information will be personally reviewed by our talent acquisition team (not by a robot). You can expect to hear back from us with feedback if we think there could be a fit and what next steps look like.

title: Director, Information Security
description:
**Director, Information Security**


**New York, NY or Columbus, OH strongly preferred**


**Remote, US welcome to apply**

  


**ABOUT BARK**

  



Here at BARK, we love dogs and their people. We're looking to make all dogs happy throughout the entire world (we're not kidding). Think Disney for dogs - we make magic for dogs and their people through our products, events, and experiences.
  

  

Our ambition level is high, the opportunity is huge, and our love for dogs is through the roof! We launched in 2011 with BarkBox, a monthly-themed subscription of all-natural treats and clever toys. Since then, we've shipped more than 70 million toys and treats to the dogs across the world and use all of that direct customer feedback to inform new initiatives and ways to make magic between dogs and their people. We've since expanded into other offerings as well, as we aim to become THE Dog Company for every family with a four-legged, belly-scratch-loving, interspecies family member.

  


**THE TEAM**



BARK's InfoSec Team manages risk and protects company assets through the assessment of risk, monitoring of vulnerabilities, and collaborating cross-functionally to reduce risk. We provide internal security engineering skills to protect current and future systems by using specialized toolsets and methods to identify vulnerabilities. We work with teams to find the optimum solution that reduces risk without impacting system security or performance.


**WHO WE'RE SNIFFIN' FOR**



We are looking for a dynamic and highly motivated InfoSec/Cybersecurity expert to join our team. The ideal candidate is a resourceful problem solver who will take ownership of critical security related work. The Director of InfoSec will report directly to the CFO and work closely with the People, Technology and Legal teams to create solutions that balance business requirements with information and cyber security requirements.


**KEY DUTIES**


* Identify and communicate current and emerging security threats
* Create solutions that balance business requirements with information and cyber security requirements
* Align standards, frameworks and security with overall business and technology strategy and objectives
* Validate reference architectures for security best practices and recommend changes to enhance security and reduce risk, where applicable
* Train end users and technical staff in the implementation, use and/or remediation of systems
* Work with General Counsel to develop policies and processes that comply with state and federal law, including incident response and data retention
* Support PCI and SOX initiatives, internal technology audits, and GDPR/CCPA initiatives
* Responsible for maintaining security and intrusion detection across infrastructure and home grown applications
* Maintain and update the target architecture for information security at BARK; continually update and maintain the security roadmap and track progress year over year
* Work with product owners to influence their products and roadmaps to ensure alignment with target architecture and vision
* Create and maintain security architecture artifacts (i.e. models, patterns, templates, etc) that can be used (and reused) to leverage security capabilities
* Create, communicate and maintain a cyber security training and awareness program for all employees at BARK.
* Manage and develop one direct team member, as well managing within financial budget


**EXPERIENCE**


#### **A diverse technical background with 10+ years' experience in:**


* Security architecture, demonstrating solutions delivery, principles and emerging technologies - Designing and implementing security solutions. This includes continuous monitoring and making improvements to those solutions.
* Consulting and engineering in the development and design of security best practices and implementation of solid security principles across the organization, to meet business goals and legal/regulatory requirements.
* Security considerations of cloud computing: including data breaches, incident response, hacking, account hijacking, insider threats, third party/vendors, data loss, DoS attacks and cloud based application delivery.
* Identity and access management - including SSO, employee remote access, third party access and device management.
* Network security - including firewalls, AWS VPC security, multi-site WAN and WIFI security.
* Encryption standards and implementation
* Prefer public company experience including knowledge of SOX


**SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS**


* Strong critical thinking and analytical skills
* Demonstrated ability to identify risks associated with business processes, operations, information security programs and technology projects
* Ability to be the security subject matter expert who can explain technical topics to those without a technical background; Exceptional communication skills with cross-functional audiences and senior leaders
* Must demonstrate proven success in working independently as well in a team and exhibit follow-through to understand root causes of issues
* Hard working with a "no task is too small" attitude
* Strong leadership and management skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire a team
* And of course, must love dogs


*This position is a full-time, salaried position. It is located on-site at our office in New York, NY or Columbus, OH. We offer health insurance for both you and your pup, 401k, wonderful team lunches, unlimited PTO and a dog to pet anytime you wish.*


**FOR CO/NJ/NY BASED APPLICANTS:**


* The base salary range for this position is **$175,000- $220,000**
* This position is eligible for equity

  


*\\*\\***This compensation range is based on BARKs good faith estimate as of the date of this posting and may be modified in the future. Actual pay for this position will depend on a variety of variables including location, travel, internal equity, experience, education, skills and expertise.*

title: Managing Vice President, Campaigns and Fundraising Consulting
description:
BWF is a mission-driven for-profit company serving the nonprofit sector, offering a comprehensive suite of solutions that ensures all nonprofit strategic, technical, and functional needs are met. Our mission is *Empowering nonprofits to achieve impact and imagine new possibilities*. Structured yet agile services in the core areas of campaign and fundraising strategy, operations and technology, fundraising marketing and engagement, and enterprise strategic planning allow BWF to deliver on its mission. Clients include universities, health systems, arts & culture organizations, faith-based organizations, and NGOs throughout North America, Europe, Africa, Australia, and the Pacific Rim. As a truly comprehensive solutions provider, BWF has a team of consultants with extensive background and experience in every facet of philanthropy.  

  

The Managing Vice President, Campaigns and Fundraising Strategy is a new position to BWF that will lead a consulting team and provide consulting services to clients. This pivotal position encompasses a variety of areas related to business development, service design and development, brand building, and resource management. The primary responsibilities of this role are to provide vision for strategic team growth in alignment with the Campaigns and Fundraising Strategy division and company direction, design forward looking services and strategies, manage the daily operations of the team and build solutions for achieving team goals and success. This role reports to the Executive Vice President, Campaigns and Fundraising Strategy, and effectively drives the company vision and strategies through focused initiatives and outcomes.  

  

**Primary Objectives**  

* Develop, execute, and drive team’s strategy in alignment with division strategic plan and goals.
* Responsible for meeting team’s sales goals through individual sales, team leadership, comprehensive sales resources, and cross-company collaboration.
* Demonstrate a growth mindset and entrepreneurial business acumen.
* Effectively, consistently, and proactively communicate team updates within the division and company-wide to ensure clarity of services, impact, and success.
* Exhibit leadership and represent our company through strong, shared values internally and externally.
* Maintain positive, professional relationships with clients, colleagues, and teams.

**Responsibilities**  

**Leadership Presence**  

* Model leadership and represent company vision, expectations, and behaviors within all areas of BWF.
* Achieve team’s strategic plan initiatives expectations and support other areas of the division as needed.
* Solve issues within team and escalate appropriately with executive vice president as needed.
* Collaborate effectively at all levels across the company to achieve desired outcomes.
* Communicate effectively and consistently related to initiatives, expectations, vision for the team in alignment with the division and company, and in a way that inspires the team and conveys possibility.

**Client Experience**  

* Responsible for up to 35% of billable/client work in an engagement leader or account manager role focused on:
* Improved client retention and loyalty.
* Enhanced client satisfaction.
* Increased number of client referrals.
* Elevating perception of BWF services in marketplace.
* Make BWF a place our clients, and non-clients, want to be associated and partner with.
* Resolve client issues within team in timely and client-centric manner.

**Business Development**  

* Responsible for lead generation and sales for team leveraging cross-company resources and personal network.
* Accountable for developing and executing team level initiatives in alignment with division and company strategic plan.
* Continually identify opportunities to increase team sales and profitability (i.e., engagement expansion, increased engagement profitability, new services) working in conjunction with division leadership and marketing.
* Present company services within existing client relationships to find ways to help solve additional client issues.

**Team Leadership**  

* Nurture individual talent, while fostering team building, through a consistent cadence of communications, 1:1s and team meetings.
* Key role in delivering team’s onboarding in alignment with division and BWF’s onboarding program.
* Advocate for team member growth and provide clear regular and constructive performance feedback.
* Ensure team members are meeting performance and revenue goals, and address development needs.
* Represent the final decisions from leadership to their respective team.
* Resolve staff conflicts in a timely and effective manner with assistance of Human Resources.
* Lead and implement strategies to foster a diverse and inclusive workplace with partnership of Human Resources.

**Team Specific**  

* Responsible and accountable for the Philanthropic Counsel team.
* Set the strategy and trajectory for ongoing development of existing and new services for the team in alignment with the division’s initiatives.
* Advance team growth through continual marketplace analysis to inform team’s strategies in alignment with market opportunities, competitive landscape, and return on investment (ROI).
* Other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications**  

* 10+ years of progressive experience in higher education or healthcare fundraising.
* 10+ years successfully leading and managing teams, demonstrating the ability to inspire and motivate staff members to achieve departmental and organizational goals.
* 3+ years of experience providing consulting services to client institutions.
* Strong financial management skills, including budget planning, forecasting, and cost optimization as well as data driven decision making.
* Demonstrated experience in driving new business and developing growth strategies.
* Proven ability to think strategically and develop and implement long-term plans.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively present complex concepts and information to diverse audiences.
* Commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion.
* Ability to support and implement organizational change in a high-growth environment.
* Preferred experience working in consultative capacity in a leadership role.
* Strong understanding of the philanthropic and nonprofit landscape and unique challenges faced by such organizations preferred.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex challenges into actionable strategies and solutions.
* Solid time management skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously.
* Ability to exercise initiative, independent judgment, and accountability for various processes and projects is crucial.
* An optimistic and entrepreneurial approach, with a willingness to take calculated risks and drive continuous improvement.
* Experience in a high-performing sales environment preferred.
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.

**Location, Hours and Working Conditions**  

* This position can be remote (within the continental United States excluding California) or based in our Minneapolis office (locally based employees are expected to maintain a hybrid office presence).
* Position requires ability to work in a stationary position for majority of workday.
* Continuous use of computer.
* Frequent communication with team and clients via zoom and in person.
* We strive to provide work/life balance whenever possible but due to the nature of this role, weekend and evening hours are required when deadlines need to be met.
* Overnight travel to client sites, conferences or firm meetings is sometimes required (up to 30% of time).

**Compensation and Benefits**  

Annual base salary range of $150,000 to $200,000 based on qualifications and experience. This position is eligible for an annual bonus based on meeting team revenue goals and profitability.  

  

BWF offers a comprehensive benefits package including:  

* 401(k) retirement plan with employer contribution
* Health insurance with HSA and FSA (medical and dependent care) options
* Employer paid dental and vision insurance, 100% employer life insurance, short and long-term disability, Long Term Care insurance, and paid parental leave.

**To apply please** ***submit a resume and cover letter*****.** Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and accepted until the position is filled. Interested applicants are encouraged to apply early.  

  

  

This is a remote position.
