title: Technical Consultant
description:
General Overview: Works under, and takes direction from District Maintenance Manager or his designee to perform maintenance, diagnostics, and repair on all electronic systems related to the fracturing process. The electronics technician works in both field and shop settings, in accordance with all company  

standard operating procedures and EH&S guidelines.  

Responsibilities:* Understand and perform all duties according to company standard operating procedures and in compliance with all regulatory guidelines and EH&S guidelines.
* Repair and maintain company equipment including:
* Electrical and electronic systems
* Recording and control software
* Field computers and network equipment
* Communicate progress of repairs and maintenance to colleagues, service writer and maintenance manager as needed
* Perform preventive maintenance on company equipment according to company and manufacturer guidelines
* Identify problem areas
* Assist in making remedial action plans
* Assist in scheduling and costing repairs
* Able to troubleshoot, diagnose, and repair electrical equipment problems
* Assist in maintaining electrical and electronic parts inventory levels, which includes:
* Ordering of new components
* Shipping and receiving of components parts out for repair
* Training of maintenance and operations personnel on electrical systems and control software and hardware
* Develop an understanding of fracturing and other oilfield operations.
* Perform work in other tasks as directed by manager.
* Performs other related duties as required.
* Other Requirements:
* High school diploma or equivalent/technical training diploma or certificate in electronics recommended.
* Experience in service company or oilfield operating company preferred
* Knowledge of electronic control systems, QA-QC and troubleshooting.
* Good verbal and written communications skills.
* Must be at least 21 years of age or older.
* Must possess ability to work independently and as a member of a team.
* Sensitive to confidential information.
* Mental and Physical Requirements:
* Able to read, speak and write English.
* Able to work under stressful conditions at times.
* Employees are regularly required to sit, walk and stand; climb up and down stairs;
* Talk or hear, both in person and by telephone; use hands repetitively to finger, handle, feel or operate standard office equipment; bending or stooping; squatting or crouching; kneeling; pushing or pulling; reach with hands and arms; and lift up to 50 pounds.
* May be required to walk for long distances, reach with hands and arms, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl, climb or balance in order to reach high places.
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision color, and the ability to adjust focus.
* Must possess good hearing as needed for work and safety compliance. Noise level could be moderate to very loud.
* Able to wear common FRC protective or safety equipment such as safety shoes, glasses, gloves, hearing protection and hard hats when needed.
* Activities may involve being around moving machinery, exposure to marked changes in temperature and humidity, and exposure to dust, fumes and gases.
* Normal physical strength & fitness to handle conditions consistent with crude trucking field operations.
* Most work schedules will be performed traveling to and working at various field locations within the service territory as required.
* Occasionally required to work near moving mechanical parts and equipment.
* Occasionally may drive for three to four hours or more at one time.
* Exposure for potential electrical shock exists for this position.
* Exposure to hazardous or toxic material may occur.
* Strong work ethics of integrity and honesty striving for excellence in all activities employing accompanying communication.
* Dependability, reliability, fulfilling responsibilities.

title: Product Design Lead
description:
Mindbloom \\uD83E\\uDDE0
We guide people through life-changing breakthroughs with the next-generation of science-backed treatments: psychedelic medicines.  

Starting with ketamine therapy for anxiety and depression, our product dramatically improves client:* Access: Costs 70% less and available 100% at-home
* Outcomes: Clinical efficacy 2x greater than antidepressants
* Experience: NPS > Amazon, Netflix, and Apple

  

Come craft the future of mental health & wellbeing — trailblazers and pioneers wanted. \\uD83D\\uDE80  

Literally Transform Lives ✨
Mental healthcare is a public health crisis that’s getting worse, and legacy treatments aren’t getting the job done.  

At Mindbloom, we alchemize medicine, software, and artful content to deliver powerful therapeutic experiences that actually work, at scale.  

For our clients, Mindbloom isn’t a vitamin nor a painkiller. It’s a life-saver.  

With Mission-Obsessed Teammates \\uD83E\\uDDD8\\uD83C\\uDFFD‍ ️\\uD83E\\uDDD8‍ ️
It all starts with a team of stunning colleagues who care passionately about our clients, our mission, and each other.  

We approach our work as an act of creative contribution back to the world. From clinicians to marketers to engineers, everyone at Mindbloom plays a critical role in guiding others through a journey of healing and personal transformation.  

Our CEO is a 3x founder building world positive companies (1 exit, 1 category leader with $120M raised), our Medical and Science Directors are pioneers in the fields of ketamine therapy and psychedelic medicine, and we’re extremely well capitalized by top tier tech and healthcare investors.  

We’re the first mover and leader in consumer psychedelic therapy, and we have aspirations to build a household brand and the largest, most transformational mental healthcare company in the world.  

We believe the team you build is the company you build. At Mindbloom, you will have a massive impact. As the Product Design Lead, you will revolutionize psychedelic therapy by revamping the end-to-end client experience to facilitate transformational experiences.  

  

Creating a More Conscious Company, Then World \\uD83C\\uDF0E
If we succeed at Mindbloom, we will:  

1. Accelerate the healthcare system’s adoption of psychedelic therapies
2. Make a dent in global human suffering
3. Expand humanity’s collective wisdom, compassion, and consciousness  

Elevating worldwide consciousness starts with elevating our own. At Mindbloom, we’re creating a more conscious company culture from first principles. We’re zealous about radical responsibility, candor, wholeness, self-actualization, focus, and freedom (we’ve been remote-first from founding). Above-all, we put clients first.  

If you’re extremely passionate about psychedelic therapies and fired up about doing the best work of your life while serving others, then let’s transform some lives together.  

Role \\uD83C\\uDFA8* Collaborate with our Founder and CEO to architect a transformational journey intertwining multiple products while delivering a premium experience
* Partner with the Head of Product and Head of Engineering to lead the creation of an AI guidance MVP to increase repeat engagement
* Drive a transformational journey of digital and physical enhancements, ensuring every touchpoint leaves customers in awe, eager to experience more of our unparalleled service
* Create a seamless immersive client experience that captivates clients and increases session engagement

  

Sound Like You? \\uD83C\\uDFA7* Extreme Ownership: Proactively identifies, designs and ships improvements to maintain a premium end-to-end client experience across digital and physical touchpoints
* Extreme Agency: Highly resourceful, moves quickly, and does whatever it takes to deliver client value
* Voice of Excellence: Uses their intuition / taste to craft exceptional client experiences that serve core user needs and inflect the business
* Mission-Obsessed: You have a personal connection to our mission
* Remote-able: You excel in a remote-first, writing-based culture of freedom and responsibility
* Practices Intellectual Honesty: You seek and speak the truth directly and possess high courage and low ego
* Makes Exceptional Decisions: You use rigor, data, and speed to make intentional decisions
* Cultivates Wholeness: You bring your authentic self to work and promote the wellbeing of team and peers
* Focus: You practice deep work, say no often, and do less, better

  

Benefits \\uD83E\\uDD1D* Insurance: Medical, dental, and vision insurance for you and dependents
* Time Off: Unlimited vacation and sick days
* Wellbeing: Steeply discounted Mindbloom products and services for yourself and immediate family
* Culture: Annual company retreat and departmental offsite
* Freedom: Design your own workday - we’ve been remote-first from founding
* Responsibility: You get what you need to excel (MacBook, standing desk, co-working space, etc.)
* Retirement: Employer sponsored 401k plan so you can save for the future

  

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.  

Mindbloom is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law.

title: Sr ITSM Platform Administrator
description:
Summary:
  

A hands-on role directly responsible for the design and maintenance of our IT Service Management (ITSM) tool as well as enabling and coordinating our ITSM standards within IT&S. This role will help enforce ITIL-based framework standards and ensure smooth operation of Summa’s ITSM software to enable appropriate workflow, reporting, and automation. Will also be responsible for the day-to-day oversight and engagement of work being delivered from managed services partners involved in ITSM development and provision. Will need to be able to interface and evangelize the capabilities and functionality of ITSM, and leveraging Ivanti, solve complex business problems to further integrate our toolsets and drive automation and ease of use.
  

  

Minimum Qualifications:
  

  

1. Formal Education Required:
  

a. BS in Computer Science / Computer Information Systems or equivalent degree, technical training, or equivalent experience can be substituted for degree.
  

  

2. Experience & Training Required:
  

a. Five (5) years experience with Ivanti (or equivalent ITSM tool) performing integrations, configuration, and customizations
  

b. Ivanti Administrator Certification preferred
  

c. Two (2) years experience creating and maintaining technical documentation and solution diagrams
  

d. ITIL Foundation Certification preferred (required within 6 months of hire)
  

e. ITIL advanced (various topic) Certification preferred (required within 1 year of hire)
  

  

3. Other Skills, Competencies and Qualifications:
  

a. Highly proficient in creating and updating documentation as part of infrastructure implementations
  

b. Proven ability to write and/or implement scripts for automation.
  

c. Advanced analytical, design, and problem-solving skills to troubleshoot system defects and mitigate the risk issues they cause.
  

d. Understanding and awareness of the business impact of critical incidents.
  

e. Expert understanding of concepts of project planning and project management techniques to assist in small projects and/or group initiatives.
  

  

4. Level of Physical Demands:
  

a. Ability to stand and sit for prolonged periods of time.
  

b. Manual dexterity to operate computer, phone, and standard office machines.  

  

$37.03/hr - $55.55/hr


The salary range on this job posting/advertising is base salary exclusive of any bonuses or differentials. Many factors, such as years of relevant experience and geographical location are considered when determining the starting rate of pay. We believe in the importance of pay equity and consider internal equity of our current team members when determining offers. Please keep in mind that the range that is listed is the full base salary range. Hiring at the maximum of the range would not be typical.

title: IT Service Continuity Management
description:
We currently have **20 week (with possible extension)** contract opportunity for a **IT Service Continuity Management can be 100% remote**  

  

**Experience:**  

* Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in IT Service Continuity Management, Business Continuity, or related fields.
* Proven track record of leading ITSCM initiatives, developing continuity plans, and implementing resilience measures within complex IT environments.
* Experience with risk assessment methodologies, business impact analysis, and developing recovery strategies for IT services and business processes.
* Hands-on experience with continuity planning tools, disaster recovery solutions, and IT infrastructure resilience technologies.
* Previous experience working in regulated industries (e.g., finance, healthcare) with knowledge of compliance requirements related to ITSCM (e.g., ISO 22301, NIST SP 800-34).


  

**Technical Skills:**  

* In-depth understanding of IT infrastructure components, including servers, networks, storage systems, and cloud technologies.
* Proficiency in ITSM frameworks and practices, such as ITIL, COBIT, or ISO/IEC 20000.
* Familiarity with backup and recovery solutions, data replication techniques, and high availability architectures.
* Knowledge of cybersecurity principles and best practices, particularly as they relate to ITSCM and protecting against cyber threats.


  

**Education and Certifications:**  

* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Administration, or equivalent work experience
* Relevant certifications in IT Service Management (ITSM) and IT Continuity Management, such as:
	+ Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)
	+ Certified Information Security Manager (CISM)
	+ ITIL (Information Technology Infrastructure Library) certifications, particularly ITIL Service Continuity Management
	+ Certified Business Continuity Professional (CBCP)
	+ Certified Disaster Recovery Planner (CDRP)

  

**Soft Skills:**  

* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and senior stakeholders.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail and the ability to identify and mitigate risks.
* Leadership qualities, including the ability to influence and inspire others, drive consensus, and lead initiatives from conception to implementation.
* Adaptability and resilience, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and navigate through uncertainty and ambiguity.


  

**Additional Preferred Qualifications:**  

* Experience with IT governance frameworks (e.g., COBIT) and regulatory compliance standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA).
* Project management certifications (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2) or experience managing ITSCM projects.
* Knowledge of emerging technologies and trends in IT resilience and continuity management.

  

This is a remote position.

title: ServiceNow ITOM Consultant
description:
The ServiceNow ITOM Consultant will support the delivery of ServiceNow solutions and development efforts, with a focus on ITOM (IT Operations Management). Includes understanding the client’s needs and challenges then applying industry best practices and in-depth knowledge of ServiceNow to design a tailored solution that enhances the IT operations and performance meeting or exceeding the functional requirements. Builds a strong rapport with key project stakeholders and guides them to the adoption of the best solution. Supports change management initiatives by providing information on the “to be” solution. Leads quality assurance activities and ensures all business and technical requirements are met. Demonstrates the application and implemented IT processes to stakeholders; may assist in developing training material and providing user training.
### **Description**


At Barrage Systems, we are passionate about delivering IT solutions and services that transform the way our clients do business. We are committed to leveraging the power of technology and innovation for clients across various sectors, including finance, healthcare, education, and government.  

Join Barrage Systems to work on exciting and challenging projects in a diverse, collaborative, and supportive environment, where you can grow, learn and excel through hands-on experience, certifications, industry training and more.  

Join us to create value, impact, and lasting change that moves our clients and the world forward!  

The ServiceNow ITOM Consultant will support the delivery of ServiceNow solutions and development efforts, with a focus on ITOM (IT Operations Management). Includes understanding the client’s needs and challenges then applying industry best practices and in-depth knowledge of ServiceNow to design a tailored solution that enhances the IT operations and performance meeting or exceeding the functional requirements. Builds a strong rapport with key project stakeholders and guides them to the adoption of the best solution. Supports change management initiatives by providing information on the “to be” solution. Leads quality assurance activities and ensures all business and technical requirements are met. Demonstrates the application and implemented IT processes to stakeholders; may assist in developing training material and providing user training.  

The ServiceNow ITOM Consultant will work closely with the Project Manager and the Technical Lead to ensure the solution is technically viable and to identify areas to optimize implementation efforts. Validates the configuration of IT data and assists the technical team for any required custom development. Supports or leads test plan development and execution including conducting user acceptance testing ensuring delivery meets client’s expectations.  

Responsibilities
1. Expert Guidance and Support: Provide expert guidance and support for ServiceNow implementations and development efforts, ensuring alignment with company goals and industry best practices.  

2. Collaboration with Stakeholders: Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather requirements, understand their needs, and translate these into technical specifications.  

3. Configuration and Customization: Configure and customize the ServiceNow platform, including ITOM, to meet specific business needs, ensuring a seamless integration with existing processes.  

4. Development of Automated Workflows: Develop automated workflows and scripts to enhance operational efficiency, reduce manual efforts, and automate key processes.  

5. Compliance and Standards Adherence: Ensure compliance with ITIL, ITSM, ITOM, GRC, SPM, and CMDB standards in all ServiceNow implementations and configurations.  

6. Training and Guidance: Provide training and guidance to team members, enhancing their understanding of ServiceNow architecture and development best practices.  

7. Continuous Improvement: Proactively identify and recommend improvements to ServiceNow processes and procedures, enhancing system functionality and user experience.  

8. Knowledge Upkeep: Stay up-to-date with the latest ServiceNow features, updates, and best practices, and apply this knowledge effectively in our environment.  

Qualifications
1. Experience: Minimum of 2 years of experience in ServiceNow consulting, though candidates with less experience may be considered if they demonstrate strong knowledge and expertise.  

2. Technical Expertise: Strong understanding of ServiceNow architecture, development, and best practices, with a focus on ITOM.  

3. Application Knowledge: Experience with ServiceNow ITSM, ITOM, and other ServiceNow applications.  

4. Standards Knowledge: Understanding of ITIL, GRC, SPM, and CMDB standards and processes.  

5. Certifications: ServiceNow certifications are required. Certifications:* CIS-Discovery.
* CIS-Service Mapping.
* CIS-Event Management.

  

6. Communication Skills: Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively interact with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.  

7. Independence and Teamwork: Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment, demonstrating flexibility and adaptability.  

Salary Range: $90,000 to $110,000 per year  

Benefits Include:
80 hours of Vacation Time after 60 days of employment.
80 hours of Sick Time after 60 days of employment.
Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance plans after 30 days of employment.  

What We Believe  

We have a steadfast commitment to diversity with the goal that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Barrage Systems has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment.  

Inclusion and diversity are essential to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and the world.  

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement  

Barrage Systems is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation.  

All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.
Barrage Systems is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

title: Design Director, Monetization
description:
Remote, United States
Design
Design Director, Monetization
Location: Los Gatos, California Preferred (San Francisco Bay Area - USA)  

  

Team: Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with over 230 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. As our slate of original productions and licensed content continues to grow and we increase our global reach, we must scale the business and look for value creation across markets and user segments.  

Within the Monetization team, revenue is our ultimate priority. To be successful, we need to find the right balance between...  

Business Case: Viability (could this make money), feasibility (does it pass the ethical, and legal bar), capability (can we build it), and cost (how much time and effort to build). To be viable, we need to consider risk and reward for both shorter (1 year) and longer-term (3+ years).  

Consumer Needs: Value considerations (does it address a real or perceived need), desirability (how important is this need relative to others), and willingness to pay.  

We are looking for an experienced design leader to manage the teams responsible for further developing and generating new business and revenue models, iterating on our global plans & pricing strategy, and identifying ad growth levers across different flows and content types to help generate revenue and keep Netflix profitable and successful.  

In this role, you'll be responsible for product innovation on plans and pricing design, and collaborate closely with several cross-functional leaders while managing a talented and diverse remote design team. You’ll help your teams design and build superlative experiences that help Netflix monetize with existing and new business models. These experiences are part of our consumer acquisition and retention flows, so experience with and a deep passion for design excellence and creativity is essential.  

This role is ideally based in our Los Gatos offices. There is also the option to be based out of LA, or remotely from the West Coast/PST working hours. Expect to travel monthly to meet with your teams, stakeholders, and partners.**Key Responsibilities**
------------------------

* Collaborate closely with your Product, Engineering, Data Science, and Operations leadership partners to plan and execute our product roadmaps.
* Develop and nurture relationships with our global stakeholders, learn the nuances of their workflows, and ensure your team is designing and shipping impactful and cohesive product experiences that meet our stakeholders’ needs.
* Balance being a passionate advocate for our users while pushing your teams towards efficient operational excellence.
* Manage and coach your design team by helping them navigate the complexity and ambiguity of our business areas.
* Keep your teams inspired and engaged by providing clear direction that looks towards the future while creating actionable steps that are impactful today.
**Skills, Characteristics & Qualifications**
--------------------------------------------

* 7+ years of experience successfully leading and scaling high-performance design teams, including ICs and people managers.
* Demonstrated passion for design excellence in the consumer space and a successful track record of shipping impactful products at a global scale.
* Experience collaborating closely with cross-functional stakeholders, helping drive alignment between design and your cross-functional partners, and building strong relationships across business areas.
* Comfortable working with ambiguity. Ability to bring rigorous design thinking and operational structure to complex and evolving problem spaces.
* Exceptional communication skills both written and verbal whether in small group discussions, large-scale presentations, or with executives.
* Ability to inspire, lead, and engage your design teams, leaning in and giving them critical business context, feedback, and direction.
* Bring a balanced perspective and thoughtful decision-making to strategic discussions, advocating for both user-centricity and the needs of the business with your teams and your peers.
**Bonus**
---------

* Experience working in the entertainment industry and a deep understanding of existing creative production and marketing technology workflows, launching successfully from 0 - 1.
* Passion for storytelling and filmmaking.

Courage when asked to join team karaoke * 
  

Pay Transparency
Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $290,000 - $1,900,000  

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off.  

See more details about our Benefits here. Netflix has a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.  

We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds more substantial teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: VP, RevOps and GTM Enablement
description:
At Protecht, we are reinventing refunds, aiming to make every purchase refundable. Our core strength lies in our proprietary Software-as-a-Service embedded refund protection platform, delivering massive distribution and a best-in-class digital purchase experience for insurance carriers; event, booking, & ticketing platforms, and consumers.


Role Overview:


Protecht seeks a VP, RevOps & GTM Enablement who will support and accelerate our growth, driving system and process accountability and efficiency across the full revenue funnel, including sales, business development, and marketing functions. The ideal candidate collaborates cross-functionally and drives operational and behavioral change to deliver defined business outcomes.


Reporting directly to the CRO, you must have a proven track record of being a key contributor to building a high-performing GTM team. You will be a hands-on leader who moves easily from strategic/conceptual to tactical/operational issues. This will be done through various initiatives and ongoing management and implementation of revenue policies, processes, technology enablement, analytics, and cross-functional partnerships.


The ideal candidate is fiercely determined, fanatical about our mission, is a good human, and has a winning mentality.


Responsibilities:

* Act as a trusted advisor to Sales, Product, Marketing, and Business Development, proactively identifying and flagging business challenges throughout the sales cycle from lead to revenue and providing insights and recommendations for business improvement (Engage - Execute - Expand).
* Proactively identify stakeholder needs and deliver dashboarding at the individual, team, and company levels. Present recommendations or additional metrics that will drive optimized performance and efficiencies.
* Drive a culture of curiosity, feedback, and continuous improvement.
* Drive continuous improvement in the lead-to-revenue tech stack.
* Manage CRM data integrity, ensuring accurate reporting
* Develop strategic and ad hoc analyses.
* Balance operational and strategic responsibilities, including managing rapid turnaround requests from multiple stakeholders, driving clarity of objectives, and rolling up sleeves to identify solutions.
* Improve efficiency for the GTM organization by establishing and driving the adoption of processes, policies, business requirements, and data governance.
* Own and maintain the GTM Playbook, which sits at the center of our company’s GTM execution.
* Produce and maintain GTM enablement materials, assets, and tools to continually improve the productiveness and results of the GTM team.
* Deliver GTM enablement training, webinars, and coaching to ensure process adherence and improvement.
* Work closely with Affiliates to ensure they are equally well enabled, using Protecht tools/assets to pass on the value of Protecht to their clients.
* Run weekly/monthly/quarterly data model reviews and retrospectives to ensure continual optimization of GTM people, processes, and technology.


Requirements:

* 10+ years of experience in Sales Operations, Revenue Operations, or GTM Operations.
* A master of sales process and lead management, enabling GTM teams to succeed in fast-paced and rapidly changing environments.
* Experience building and managing a world-class CRM instance.
* Proficiency with a wide range of sales effectiveness tools and technology.
* A service mindset and focus on identifying and solving problems for key stakeholders.
* Demonstrated success as a people leader.
* Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to structure and interpret data to inform decision-making.
* Demonstrated ability to identify root cause issues independently, develop solutions, and reduce complexity.
* Strong business acumen and ability to think and operate cross-functionally; a “hands-on" work style with a "do-what-it-takes attitude;” not afraid to roll up sleeves.
* Adaptable to a fast-paced, changing environment.
* Comfort with ambiguity.
* High sense of urgency and personal accountability.
* Dedication to what we’re building at Protecht.
* This is a remote position - travel to Protecht HQ in Phoenix, AZ, and team meetings are required as necessary.
* Travel required ~25% of the time.


What We Offer:

* Fully Remote Working Environment
* Competitive Salary and Equity Opportunities
* Unlimited Paid Time-off
* Full Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits
* Annual Bonus Program
* 401k Matching
* $100/month for Event Ticket Purchase
* Company Sponsored Events

title: Senior UX Strategist
description:
**The Role:**  

Minted is seeking a Sr UX Strategist to join the multidisciplinary UX team responsible for our digital experience across web and app. The UX team partners extensively with Product, Engineering, Merchandising, Product Marketing, Brand and Creative teams to support the Product organization's roadmap and define Minted’s future capabilities. We approach each project as an opportunity to exceed our customer and artist expectations—designing the right experiences, at the right time, the right way.  

Anticipated Start Date: 3/26/2024  

#LI-AN1 #LI-Remote
### **You Will:**

* Maintain an active and evolving connection to the needs of our customers and artists
* Create an evolving set of principles and guides for content, language, and positioning across all of Minted
* Concept prototypes for new features and frameworks that both drive and inform business strategy
* Help determine prioritization of design work based on a deep understanding of present and future user needs
* Build tools and systems to communicate the direction of Minted customers back to the business
* Collaborate with UX Design, Product, Product Marketing, Merchandising, Engineering, Data Science, and leadership to scope and solve Minted’s toughest and most unexplored business challenges

### **You Are:**

* A Senior/Lead level UX Strategist who has significant experience leading teams and addressing high-stakes business challenges
* Passionate about building an iterative and imaginative environment where new ideas can flourish
* A mentor or people manager who enjoys helping others meet their potential, and equally enjoys rolling up their sleeves to dive into the work
* A highly skilled communicator who knows how to challenge ideas gracefully
* An open collaborator who listens and enjoys having their ideas challenged
* A storyteller — you bridge the gap between current & future user journeys
* An expert in user-centric design, visual design, user behavior, interactions, brand, and content best practices
* Deeply versed in design trends across app, mobile web, desktop, tablet, etc
* Able to oversee and advise full research cycles, and familiar with best practices in addition to qualitative and quantitative methods

### **You Have:**

* Deep user empathy and a natural curiosity for what drives behavior
* An interest in educating partners on how to make the most of UX Strategy—leading Minted’s first UX Strategy pod, you’ll set the standard
* Significant experience tying UX strategy to headway on tough business challenges

**Compensation:**  

The compensation range for the role applies to both employment offers and Minted employees actively working in the role. **Our employment offers fall between the minimum and midpoint of the range** to allow for continued salary growth during your employment at Minted. The upper half of the range accommodates this growth and supports our intention to create an environment that encourages lasting relationships between Minted and our employees.  

Geo Base Full Salary Range 0 - Includes SF Bay Area - $124,000 - $186,000 (Midpoint $155,000)
Geo Base Full Salary Range 1 - All non-SF CA, DC, NY - $114,080 - $171,120 (Midpoint $142,600)
Geo Base Full Salary Range 2 - Includes CO, IL, MA, MD, NJ, OR, RI, TX, VT, VA, WA - $105,400 - $158,100 (Midpoint $131,750)
Geo Base Full Salary Range 3 - Includes AL, AK, AZ, AR, CT, DE, FL, GA, IA, ID, IN, KS, KY, LA, ME, MI, MN, MO, MS, MT, ND, NE, NM, NV, NH, NC, OH, OK, PA, SC, SD, TN, UT, WI, WV, WY - $96,720 - $145,080 (Midpoint $120,900)  

This role is eligible for an annual performance bonus and stock options. **Benefits:**
Benefits will be effective the first of each month following your initial hire date.
* Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits
* Employer Funded Health Savings Account
* 10 Paid Holidays
* Paid Time Off and Sick Leave
* Paid Parental Leave
* Employer Paid Wellbeing Apps (e.g. Headspace and Calm)
* Monthly Gym/Wellness Reimbursement
* 401(k) retirement savings plan
* Employer Funded Commuter Benefits
* Employee Discount
* Friends and Family Discount

 **About Minted**:  

Artists shape culture. They spark conversation, create connection, and bring beauty into the world. Minted is where they come together to reach further. Our marketplace empowers a thriving community of independent artists to sell and scale their work. We nurture self-expression, cultivate community, and bring the best in visual art to a global audience.  

We’re building a new way to discover the world’s best creative talent. We’re here for the emerging talent ready to take off, the local favorites ready to grow, and the established artists ready to dream bigger.  

At Minted, our people don’t just believe in the power of art–we live it. We have our finger on the pulse of what’s new and now. We’re obsessed with great design, art, and interiors. We’re in galleries, at fairs, and constantly finding inspiration online. We seek undiscovered talent that deserves to stand up and stand out. We connect with artists that have something to say, and we collaborate to amplify their work. The Minted community’s art, stationery, and textiles products have reached over 75 million homes worldwide.  

Our marketplace brings the best in independent design to consumers everywhere. We recognize the challenges independent artists face, and we leverage our resources to level the playing field and create a platform that gives artists the freedom to develop their craft and grow their business.  

We are headquartered in San Francisco, CA and currently employ 350+ full-time employees, plus additional temporary workers during the holiday season. We have raised over $300M from top-tier investors including Benchmark Capital, T. Rowe Price, Permira, Ridge Ventures, Technology Crossover Ventures, and Norwest Venture Partners. Angel investors include Marissa Mayer, Jeremy Stoppelman, Julia & Kevin Hartz, Yishan Wong, and more.  

Minted is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to inclusion and diversity. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives and will consider all qualified applicants for employment in accordance with all state, local, and federal laws. Minted participates in the E-verify program. **How Our Process Works:**  

Minted uses technology and innovative practices to bring unique, best-selling design to market at scale. Using its crowdsourcing technology, consumers are empowered to vote for the designs they love and want to see sold, ensuring that Minted always sells continuously fresh and trend-forward product. The winning designs are manufactured by Minted, enabling artists from around the world to share and sell their work while letting Minted do the rest. Since launch in 2007, the company has expanded to serve consumers in new categories including wall art, textiles, digital content and home decor, as well as serve major retailers and consumer products brands with data-backed design through licensing and wholesale partnerships.

title: Global Program Manager - Early Career
description:
Greif offers a great working environment and the opportunity to make an immediate impact at a company where your ideas are always welcome.
Job Requisition #:
026678 Global Program Manager - Early Career (Open)
Job Description:
Summary
At Greif, we believe developing talent is critical to our long-term success. We are hiring a Global Program Manager, Early Careers to expand our Early Career recruiting strategy & program globally. This role is responsible for building relationships & partnerships, increasing employer branding and awareness, and identifying & attracting top talent from universities, local colleges and technical program institutions. Early Careers at Greif includes not only professional Interns & Cop-Ops, but also high demand skilled technical & manufacturing Interns & Apprentices. The Global Program Manager will be responsible for the continual evolution of our professional program, as well as for the design & implementation of a global program for skilled manufacturing talent. You will coordinate and manage all aspects of the recruitment process, including event planning, logistics, and related program activities & events. You will manage a small team of regional Early Career Talent Specialists, and partner with and present to key business leaders & stakeholders to drive expansion of a global Early Career recruitment program.
As a valued member of the Talent Attraction team, the Global Program Manager, Early Careers collaborates closely with hiring managers, academic institutions, and other stakeholders to develop effective recruitment strategies and build strong relationships with prospective candidates. You will develop & present regular updates and reports to hiring managers and senior leadership on recruitment activities, progress, and challenges. Additionally, you will track and analyze recruitment metrics to evaluate the effectiveness of our recruitment strategies and make data-driven recommendations for improvement. In this role you will utilize your extensive experience in University Relations and Early Career talent recruiting, strong knowledge of creative sourcing strategies and full lifecycle recruiting best practices to lead and manage your team.
This position can be hybrid or fully remote, based in the eastern US, and reports to the Director, Global Talent Attraction.  


Principle Duties and Responsibilities* Partner with regional business leaders and HR teams to assess Voice of the Customer and business needs to ensure program alignment with organizational priorities
* Serve as subject matter expert on strategy, development, and execution of all programs for early career talent; socialize & present to key senior leaders and stakeholders to gain buy-in, including required investments
* Develop an agile and scalable global program and team to adapt to changing business priorities and program maturity
* Leverage existing Early Careers recruitment practices to develop a global end to end program for Co-Ops, Apprenticeships, Interns and recent Graduates
* Oversee full-cycle recruitment process for Early Careers talent
* Work with internal teams to develop communications and engagements to increase program & employer brand recognition
* Develop & foster relationships with students, student organizations, faculty, and Career Services at target campuses to provide best in class engagement
* Develop & conduct training and educational sessions for participating Hiring Managers, key stakeholders, and program participants
* Measure and assess program effectiveness; generate reports and create data driven insights that represent the growth & success of early career programs
* Plan, execute, and participate in campus recruiting activities such as campus presentations, career fairs, coffee chats, networking events, job platforms, and social media campaigns.
* Plan and implement Early Careers on-boarding and post hire engagement activities, events and group activities such as Intern Summit, newsletters, surveys, etc.
* Partner with Global Talent Center colleagues to create learning plans to support development needs of our Early Career talent
* Develop a high performing team to support Early Careers recruiting globally.


Education & Experience* Bachelor’s degree
* Minimum 8 years’ experience in recruitment or related talent programs to include at least 3 years directly supporting Early Careers Co-Op & Intern talent
* Minimum 3 years leadership experience either directly managing a recruiting team, leading recruiting operations or in a program management role
* Demonstrated experience designing, implementing, and running Talent programs across multiple businesses or geographic locations


Knowledge, Skills, Abilities* Proven stakeholder management expertise and an ability to liaise & influence various levels of management, including engaging with senior leaders across organizational departments and geographical cultures
* Experience building new talent programs from the ground up, inclusive of stakeholder buy in and investment garnering
* High-level of critical thinking and strategic mindset required; can adapt and pivot, as necessary
* Excellent organizational, data analysis, project management skills
* Learning agility, ability to work in ambiguity, and the ability to work in fast-paced environment with competing priorities
* Understanding of regional talent markets complexities and compliance
* Highly skilled in creating & delivering compelling data driven presentations
* Proven track record attracting & engaging Early Career talent in highly competitive markets
* Continuous improvement mindset, recommending new approaches to current processes and procedures
* Strong knowledge of Applicant Tracking Systems, HRIS tools, associated job boards and candidate platforms
* Ability to travel up to 25% as needed and attend both virtual and in-person recruitment events

title: Manager, Machine Learning - Studio Intelligence
description:
Remote, United States
Data Science and Engineering
At Netflix, our mission is to entertain the world by connecting our members to an extensive library of amazing stories from all over the globe. We are revolutionizing storytelling as we deliver content to 260+ million members across 190+ countries in 30+ languages. Developing data-driven methods and systems to help Netflix teams plan and manage the operations supporting content production is a critical part of that mission.  

We’re looking for a Manager to lead the Studio Intelligence Machine Learning team. This talented team operates at the heart of Netflix’s business: helping Content and Studio functions forecast and plan our content financials and scheduling. This work informs decision-making on investments for new original shows. We develop new data sets and pipelines, deliver analytic tools, conduct statistical analyses, and build machine learning models, all with the goal of helping our creative teams produce the best shows and movies.
**In this role, you will:**
---------------------------

* Lead and mentor a group of Data Scientists and Analytics Engineers with diverse skill sets that cut across statistics, machine learning, analytics, and data engineering
* Craft and evolve a strategic vision for research and implementation of forecasting algorithms and analytics in content planning
* Identify, explore, and own new, creative applications of data science and machine learning across Content Operations workflows
* Establish and maintain strong partnerships with business stakeholders, working directly with them to introduce and influence data-informed ways of working
* Collaborate with other Data Science and Engineering teams to uplevel our foundational data models and data health
* Partner with Product and Engineering teams to develop holistic technical solutions for Content Finance, Content Planning, and Content Production business teams
**The ideal candidate will have:**
----------------------------------

* Multiple years of experience building and managing high-performing data science teams; a demonstrated track record of driving innovation and shaping business strategy with data
* A self-starter mindset; a high degree of comfort working amidst ambiguity and leading in a fast-paced environment
* A passion for people leadership: you are energized by hiring, coaching, and investing in your team members
* A background working as a hands-on individual technical contributor in a data field: machine learning, statistics, operations research, or data science, as examples
* Familiarity with deploying data science solutions into production environments and comfort partnering closely with Engineering teams
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, able to act as the bridge between technical and non-technical audiences

Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $360,000 - $920,000.  

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.  

Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

title: Software Engineer, L4, Open Connect Probnik
description:
Remote, United States
Open Connect is a critical group within Netflix that builds and manages a content delivery network (CDN) handling more than one third of North American internet traffic at peak times! We strive to deliver a great Netflix viewing experience in over 190 countries so our customers can watch whatever, whenever, interruption free. Over 260 million members around the globe are currently enjoying more than 16 billion hours per month of original series, documentaries and feature films. Come work alongside some of the best and most experienced engineers of the CDN industry.  

Open Connect Appliances (OCAs) are ideally situated to improve the latency between clients and the Netflix services running on AWS. The Open Connect Edge Accelerator is taking advantage of the highly geo-distributed nature of Open Connect to improve the quality of experience. It is the entry point for device and website traffic, putting it on the critical path to delivering and monitoring our product experiences. You can learn more about us by watching this QCon talk presented by Sergey from our team. We are looking for a software engineer to improve the solution and build new features. You will be working on latency measurement, steering solutions, protocol optimizations and to name a few.**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Develop and maintain the Probnik service in production
* Partner with other teams across engineering to gather and implement new requirements
* Setup, run and analyze network measurements
**You are**
-----------

* Someone who likes to work hands-on and be self-directed in a fast-paced environment that gives you freedom and responsibility.
* Able to see beyond immediate specs, summarize requirements, and architect forward-looking solutions.
* Capable of working in a cross-functional collaborative environment alongside your teammates.
* An advocate for the customer who is passionate about addressing customer pain points.
**Requirements**
----------------

* 4+ years of previous experience in a Software Engineering role
* Professional level proficiency in Java, Python, Go or Javascript
* Experience developing and operating services receiving high scale traffic
* Data crunching using Hive, Pig, Kibana, Tableau, or similar.
* Good understanding of the Internet protocols like TCP, TLS, HTTP and DNS.
* Great communication and documentation skills targeted at cross-team collaboration.
* Motivated by “the art of possible” and able to balance idealism and pragmatism.
* Cool-headed during production issues, able to focus on problem resolution.
  

Does this sound interesting? Or does this sound interesting but intimidating? Please don’t self-select out, let’s figure it out together. We’d love to talk to you!  

Netflix is a global company with a diverse member base, which is why the content we produce reflects that: global perspectives and global stories. As we grow globally, we must have the most talented employees with diverse backgrounds, cultures, perspectives, and experiences to support our innovation and creativity. We are an equal-opportunity employer and strive to build balanced teams from all walks of life.  

Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix here.  

Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $500,000.  

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.  

Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

title: DVP, Information Technology (IT)
description:
**About Us****:**
At AMETEK, you’ll collaborate with innovative colleagues to create technology that changes the world. Enjoy the support, resources, and best practices that AMETEK has to offer while having the autonomy and flexibility to work on diverse teams and projects.  


**Job Summary:**The DVP of Information Technology (IT) will have overall responsibility for the stable and efficient operation of the Division’s Business Systems environment. He/she will be a business partner with the Division General Manager and his/her staff and will anticipate and recommend opportunities where Information Technology can advance the capabilities of, and be utilized to provide a competitive advantage for, the Division. The DVP, IT will develop and execute a strategic plan for the Division’s systems within the context of the overall Division business strategy and the company’s IT strategic direction.
In addition to serving as the IT leader for the Division, the DVP, IT will also provide enterprise IT support at the AMETEK corporate level, working closely with the corporate team on initiatives affecting IT across all divisions. This includes providing participation in future acquisition due diligence, post-acquisition integration, Sarbanes Oxley audit support and Cyber security when appropriate.  


**Key Responsibilities:**
* Manage all aspects of business systems and information technology in the Division.
* Work with the business unit management teams to develop and execute strategy including identifying the appropriate use of IT to improve the capabilities and performance of the Division.
* Ensure a stable and efficient business system and communications environment.
* Lead the IT due diligence activities for acquisitions. Make significant contributions to work in the area of investigation of potential acquisitions and lead post acquisition integration execution and delivery.
* Develop and maintain a high performing Business Systems and Information Technology Team.
* Contribute to the development of corporate standards and Policies related to IT and Business Systems.
* Provide thought leadership around the application of Sarbanes Oxley and Cyber Security compliance standards.
* Ensure the Division is adhering to all corporate information security standards and policies.
* Lead the deployment of Cyber Security initiatives in line with AMETEK policy within the Division.
* Provide business analytics in support of the business growth strategies.
* Indirectly supervise local and remote employees located throughout the US at various manufacturing plant locations.
* Lead the development of the Divisional IT 3-5 year strategy by working with BU and Divisional leadership to translate business strategies and initiatives into IT strategic plans.
  


**Minimum Qualifications****:**
* 10+ years of proven, progressive IT leadership, including global experience in an engineering-centric, product development, and delivery organization. This includes a successful IT business leader who understands and leads technology’s application for driving real business value. This experience should also include a proven track record of exceptional IT build, deliver, and support experience.
* Undergraduate degree in a technical discipline, ideally computer science or engineering, or related discipline with an IT focus.
* Must have participated in and subsequently led several full life cycle ERP implementations in multi-site discrete manufacturing business.
* Must have participated in and subsequently led several full-cycle CRM implementations using leading CRM platforms.
* Ability to travel extensively and frequently through North America and Europe; 50% minimum.

  


**Desired Qualifications:**
* An advanced degree or MBA is a plus.
* Strong business and financial acumen. Experiencing working for a publicly-traded company continuously pressured to lower costs while improving performance.
* Prior experience in a business operations role and/or a consulting practice highly desirable.
* Understanding of, and skill in developing executable strategic plans.
* Demonstrated skill and success in managing an organization including budgeting, hiring, developing, and positioning resources in support of the function.
* Excellent communication and presentational skills.
* Well-developed critical thinking and diagnostic skills.
* Experience evaluating, conducting due diligence on, and integrating acquisitions is highly desirable. Experience in a Six Sigma / LEAN Manufacturing environment where these tools were applied to the “office” environment is preferred.
* Ability to predict, recognize and manage cultural and technological changes within the organization and the corresponding transitions required. It is essential the applicant understand technology direction and trends and their strategic business impact.
* Able to develop collaborative, productive working relationships across AMETEK beyond the Division.

  


**What’s in It for You:**
* Competitive compensation, holiday pay, and paid time off
* Great benefits package that includes health, vision, and dental insurance
* 401(k), plus matching
* Flexible spending accounts (FSAs), health savings account (HSA) with AMETEK contribution, life insurance, disability insurance, and family medical leave
* Employee referral program
* Tuition reimbursement program
* Employee assistance program
* Exciting, fast-paced environment where you could make a true impact
* Opportunities for career advancement within our business unit and across all other AMETEK business entities

  


**Additional Details:**
This position is a remote role. Travel will be required.  


**To learn more about our company and our job opportunities, visit us at:**

title: Veeva CRM Consultant
description:
**Introduction**


At Slipstream IT we work to streamline IT Support and provide managed solutions with a strategic consulting and global leadership management approach. Our solutions are designed exclusively for emerging pharma and biotech organizations. Slipstream’s industry-leading solutions free clients from the demands of internal IT and allow them to rapidly advance their mission. Led by a leadership team that has been together for over 10 years, you will join a proven team, culture, and strategy to drive innovation within the IT outsourcing industry while developing your skillset with the opportunities for internal growth.


**Responsibilities:**


* Coordinates and Leads Veeva CRM support resources at client - Weekly meetings.
* Escalation point for internal technical questions at client.
* Provides Ticket Resolution for Veeva products in the Ticketing System.
* Troubleshoot issues with Veeva products and all integrations.
* Provide support and administration for Veeva products.
* Performs Configuration Changes in Veeva products.
* Documents Business Requirements.
* Can perform Project Work – Veeva CRM Configuration changes, testing, deployment activities, and Veeva CRM integrations.
* Coordinates with third party integration points for changes, testing, and deployment activities.


**Requirements:**


* Strong knowledge of Life Science (Pharma) –Sales Business Process.
* Experience with Configuring custom objects, layouts, reports, CLM functions in Veeva platform.
* Experience in data analysis and migration of CRM data from legacy systems into Veeva.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to articulate concepts and ideas related to assigned projects and customer support.
* Strong teamwork skills with the ability to work in cross-functional, global teams as well as independently.
* Veeva CRM Certified.
* SFDC Admin Certification.


**Benefits**


* 401k match
* Comprehensive group health, dental, vision benefits
* Life insurance/LTD
* Discretionary PTO


*Slipstream IT is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation or identity, national origin, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws. Slipstream IT makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.*


*This job description may not be inclusive of all assigned duties, responsibilities, or aspects of the job described, and may be amended at any time at the sole discretion of the Employer.*

description:

title: Director, Content Analysis
description:
Remote, United States
Creative Production
Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 238 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

Since the days of DVDs in envelopes, our editorial insights analysts have brought context to content, analysing and tagging titles on service to help match titles to members, and to help members choose those that are right for them. Now as Netflix explores a broader world of entertainment – expanding into Games, Live, Ads and more – we are looking for a leader to take the Content Analysis teams to their next act: more metadata, more global, more impact.

As a senior leader in the Product Metadata and Ratings group, you’ll be responsible for scaling the Content Analysis teams to key markets around the world to capture the local nuances of a global catalogue; for creating and managing relationships at all levels of the company – including Content and Product – in a complex matrixed environment; driving innovation in the ways we think about content and member needs; for transforming workflows to take advantages of ML and AI – and doing it all at the scale and quality our users and cross-functional partners demand.**You will:**
-------------

* Lead several teams of content analysts, based all around the world.
* Be accountable for how we classify, rate and review content and assets in a way that supports existing and new use-cases across the Netflix business.
* Set the vision for the department, define performance standards, annual objectives, key results and roadmaps
* Be accountable for your teams maintaining performance standards, achieving key results and setting up the appropriate recurring review processes to ensure they are on track in a fast-paced operationally critical environment.
* Manage day-to-day partnerships across the business, creating and facilitating working relationships across Merchandising, Product, Content, local leadership teams, and Ratings. You will work with leadership at all levels across the business and must fluidly communicate between organisations
* Work with technology, operations and innovation leaders to drive progress in new forms of content classification – and the use of emerging technologies to classify at scale
* Ensure obstacles to launching and supporting key projects are addressed for your team. You will elevate opportunities and challenges with solutions to improve efficient and effective output, as needed
* Be responsible for the development and growth of your teams and their leaders
**Your teams will:**
--------------------

* Analyse every title on service with the appropriate fidelity to support our partners in Ratings, Merchandising, Product Discovery and Promotion, Ads, Product Management and more.
* Own the strategy, execution and performance of content and asset classification
* Play a crucial role in bringing member discovery innovations to life by bringing content and analysis experience to bear on Merchandising strategies and Product innovations.
**Qualifications**
------------------

* 10+ years of experience in a field encompassing any of product metadata, audience engagement, content classification and curation, content insights, content strategy and management, or similar.
* Must have experience directly managing leaders of teams or large teams
* Deep understanding of consumer behaviours and discovery habits with entertainment, understands how those intersect with content catalogue and services
* Should have experience in running globally distributed and remote-first teams
* Strategic, analytical thinker with a strong customer-focused mindset and empathy
* Excellent written (memos and presentations) and verbal communication skills; timely communication
* Highly motivated self-starter with the ability to work independently and drive alignment amid ambiguity
* Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders and effectively influence and contribute with concrete recommendations/next steps, across both regional and global teams
* Comfortable applying a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to define success
* Insatiable curiosity to learn new domains, keep up with industry innovation, and constantly ask ‘why’

At Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location.  

The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $530,000-$1,030,000.  

This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.  

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

title: Consultant - Atlassian Tools
description:
**Overview**
------------



Isos Technology is looking for an energetic and personable professional to join our team. The right candidate will be a team player who effectively builds relationships both inside and outside the organization. He/she is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of our clients and consultants. This professional consultant works directly with clients for effective deployment of Isos Technology products and services. This individual is a self-starter who values team input and is willing to give input for the betterment of the team.

  

### **Consulting Responsibilities**


*As an Atlassian Consultant you will provide design, solutioning, and implementation services within the Atlassian technologies. You will have the following responsibilities:*

* Serve as Atlassian Tools Subject Matter Expert; advise Client(s) on best practices, guidelines and recommendations
* Analyze how Clients' teams, departments, and divisions use technologies to manage their work
* Work with Isos internal and Client(s) to groom the backlog of work activities required to meet all the business objectives of the engagement
* Architect and deliver enterprise solutions using the Atlassian suite including the Atlassian Marketplace apps
* Advise and train Client(s) on how to manage and evolve their use of the Atlassian suite
* Maintain and provide access to accurate task lists, especially Kanban boards, Scrum boards and any other required artifacts that express specific tasks, completion status and dependent activities
* Be accountable for staying within the budget agreed to for each engagement
* Provide support to Sales team for pitches, proposals, and pre-engagement budget estimation and contract creation
* Regularly contribute informative and engaging original content to be used in Isos Atlassian Services marketing efforts in the form of white papers, blog posts and social media status updates
 *To function in the role of an Atlassian Consultant, Isos requires you already have the following demonstrable and verifiable skills:*


* Ability to conduct yourself professionally and within Isos values
* Ability to effectively manage time and expectations
* Ability to manage multiple clients and projects simultaneously
* Ability to communicate effectively (both orally and in writing) for executive, technical and business operations audiences
* Minimum 5+ years experience and/or expert knowledge of all supported versions of Atlassian, ServiceNow, JIRA and Confluence
* A combination of advanced or end user knowledge of all other supported Atlassian products
* Minimum 5+ years experience managing software tool implementations over a complex lifecycle, especially including:
	+ Discovering and documenting requirements
	+ Complex analysis with a special focus on process discovery
	+ Creative problem-solving
	+ Written, face to face and group presentation based communication to multiple audiences
* Minimum 5+ years experience as project leader on large projects, Large projects are projects with some combination of the following characteristics:
	+ 5 or more materially engaged participants
	+ 2 or more independent organizations (not business units within the same organization)
	+ geographically distributed teams
	+ multiple phases over more than 3 months

*This position is primarily a work from home position and we consider applicants throughout the United States. We support pay transparency, the compensation range for this position is between $80,000 - $130,000 and this position is eligible for the employee bonus program. Actual compensation can vary based on qualifications, experience, and geographic pay differentials.*


*Isos Technology is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, color, age, physical or mental disability, spousal affiliation, marital status, a serious medical condition, genetic information, veteran status or any other basis prohibited by federal, state, or local law.* Candidates must be willing to participate in and successfully pass a background check and pre-employment drug testing and be authorized to work in the United States. HyperVelocity Consulting is an E-Verify participating employer.

  

E-Verify Participation Notice: https://e-verify.uscis.gov/web/media/resourcesContents/E-Verify\\_Participation\\_Poster\\_ES.pdf



E-Verify Right to Work: https://www.e-verify.gov/sites/default/files/everify/posters/IER\\_RightToWorkPoster%20Eng\\_Es.pdf

title: Category Manager - IT and R&D
description:
Summary:
Duties & Responsibilities:
VIAVI (NASDAQ: VIAV) has a 90+ year history of technical innovations that have evolved to keep pace and address our customer’s most pressing business issues. We make equipment, software, and systems that help to plan, deploy, certify, monitor, and optimize all kinds of networks - like those for mobile phones, service providers, large businesses and data centers. VIAVI is also a leader in high performance thin film optical coatings and engineered diffusers, providing light management solutions to anti-counterfeiting, consumer electronics, automotive, defense and instrumentation markets.
We are the people behind the products that help keep the world connected – at home, school, work, at play, and everywhere in between. VIAVI employees are fierce about supporting customer success and we welcome people who bring their best every day to the company - to question, to collaborate and to push for solutions that will delight our customers.
Job Summary* Responsible for building category strategy to ensure operational efficiencies (R&D or IT)
* Establishes a strong network and fosters collaboration with customers, suppliers, key stakeholders, and team members.
* Establishes and maintains vendor performance data and reports metrics to leadership.
* Develop scenario plans for evolving environment within category.


Duties and Responsibilities* Development and implementation of category strategy to provide resources on time, minimizing risk to customers and ensuring optimum price.
* Develop and maintain category plans that identify opportunities for operational efficiencies, drive cost savings, manage risk, improve safety, drive innovation, and ensure the continuous development of categories managed.
* Supervise, plan, manage and assume complete responsibility for all activities and processes associated with the categories assigned.
* Develop & maintain expert knowledge of global supply markets and product innovations
* Perform procurement reporting and analysis of management information to identify potential improvement opportunities.
* Identify innovative procurement solutions that provide cashable savings and process efficiencies for the organization.
* Address vendor issues to ensure the highest level of service delivery.
* Maintain contractual and business relationships with vendors.
* Facilitate implementation of procurement change initiatives within the category to improve business performance.


Pre-Requisites / Skills / Experience Requirements:
Qualifications* Bachelor’s degree in supply chain, engineering, finance, business or related field
* An advanced degree is a plus
* Professional certification (e.g., CPM, CPSM, CIRM, CPIM) is a plus
* 5+ years’ experience in procurement, sourcing or related field delivering similar job outcomes
* Proven track record of working with sourcing and procurement teams both onshore and offshore


If you have what it takes to push boundaries and seize opportunities, apply to join our team today.
VIAVI Solutions is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer – minorities/females/veterans/persons with disabilities.
Job Posting Pay Range:
74,718
to
138,762
Exceptional qualifications, experience and location may impact salary. VIAVI offers a competitive benefits package that includes paid time off, health, life and disability insurance, 401(k), and a bonus program.
